column2: Peoples Party Raises Objections Over Transparency of Elections
column5:
Karachi (July 25, 2018): Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) has raised alarms over the transparency of polling process in the parliamentary elections.
Addressing a press conference here on Wednesday, PPP leaders Raza Rabbani and Sherry Rehman said there seemed to be a clear trend of interference in the polling process.
Raza Rabbani said that PPP’s polling agents were expelled from polling stations in Karachi’s Lyari.
The ECP and caretaker government have failed to ensure the transparency of the elections, he said.
“There will be severe consequences if public opinion is tempered with,” warned the former chairman Senate.
The ECP has abdicated all responsibility in this election and have been nothing more than pawns. From throwing out polling agents to withholding results, the facade has been stripped away. This is blatant rigging !
— Aseefa B Zardari (@AseefaBZ) July 25, 2018
Where as  PPP’s Aseefa Bhutto Zardari said “The ECP has abdicated all responsibility in this election and have been nothing more than pawns”.

column2: Chief Election Commissioner To Announce First Election Result
column5:
Islamabad (July 25, 2018): Election Results will be transmitted through the fastest and modern system to Elections commission of Pakistan.
According to the Election Commission, Results Transmission System (RTS) is linked to 80,000 polling stations across the country.
Chief Election Commissioner Sardar Muhammad Raza Khan will announce first election result.
Abb Takk has acquired the result but it will announce the result at 7 pm because Media is not permitted to announce election results before 7 p.m. All the results will be released through RTS and Result Management System to ensure accuracy and promptness.

column2: Polling For General Elections 2018 Concludes
column5:
Islamabad (July 25, 2018): Polling for the 11th general election in Pakistan officially closed at 6pm.
Polling time started 9 am in the morning across the country, people who get into polling station before 6 pm will be able to cast their votes.Counting has begun at certain polling stations. Results cannot be announced before 7pm according to ECP guidelines.
Out of 272 National Assembly seats, election is being held on 270 seats, while election on two National Assembly constituencies has been postponed.As for the four Provincial Assemblies, election held on 570 seats against the total 577 seats.
Over 12,500 candidates are in the run for National and Provincial Assemblies. According to the electoral rolls, 105.96 million voters are eligible to cast vote. Of them, 59.22 million are male and 46.73 million are females.

Earlier, Shehbaz Sharif urged masses to come out and vote for the country.
Just cast my vote. High time that all of you came out to vote for Pakistan’s progress and prosperity. May this election be a source of peace and stability for the nation! pic.twitter.com/uiUZYdo09j

column2: General Election 2018: Polling Begins Across Country
column5:
Karachi(July 25, 2018): Voting for general elections-2018 has begun across the country and around 105.95 million registered voters will exercise their right of the franchise today to elect their representatives for the National Assembly and provincial assemblies for the next five years.
The polling process started at sharp 8 am and will continue till 6pm without break today. Those who are inside the premises of a polling station by the expiry of this time will be allowed to cast their votes.The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) has set up 85,252 polling stations to cast vote.  It has hired services of 819,119 polling staff from different government departments to act as presiding officers, assistant presiding officers and polling officers to conduct polls.The nation will elect 270 members of the National Assembly and a total of 570 members of four provincial assemblies for the next five-year term (2018-2023) today.
Around 105.95 million eligible voters – 59.22 million males and 46.73 million females – will exercise their right to vote to mark another democratic transition from one elected government to another.
About 1,1673 candidates are vying for 270 national and 570 provincial seats.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Elections have been postponed on two NA and six provincial seats, while one candidate has been declared winner unopposed on a provincial seat.
Elections have been postponed in NA-60 owing to disqualification of PML-N candidate Hanif Abbasi. Polls have also been postponed in NA-103 over death of independent candidate Mirza Muhammad Ahmed Mughal.
Election on six provincial constituencies including PK-78, PP-87, PP-103, PS-87, PK-99 and PB-35 have also been postponed due to the death of candidates.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Election Commission of Pakistan has established 83, 307 polling stations, 17,000 of them have been declared as sensitive.
The ECP has set up 23, 424 polling stations for male voters and 21,707 for female voters.
Around 40, 133 combined polling stations and 43 improvised polling stations have been set up. CCTV cameras have been installed at sensitive polling stations.As many as 53,000 international, national and local observers and media persons will monitor the elections.
A large number of candidates, including many electables, are contesting as independents. If elected in big numbers, they would have an important role in formation of governments in Centre and provinces.
Highly Sensitive
Authorities have declared 17,007 polling stations ‘highly sensitive’, a term used for an area where there has been violence in the past or the law enforcement agencies report chances of violence like fighting among the supporters of the candidates.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Of these highly sensitive polling stations 5,878 are located in Sindh, 5,487 in Punjab and Islamabad Capital Territory, 3,874 in Khyber Pakhtunkwa (K-P) and 1,768 in Balochistan. However, the authorities cannot map out security alerts of serious nature like terrorist attacks. According to the ECP secretary these alerts reflect possibility of attacks on polling stations, election staff and leading politicians.
The country has seen a significant decline in terror incidents over the past couple of years. However, since the electioneering gained momentum later last month a new wave of terror attacks also started in the K-P and Balochistan, the provinces worst affected by violence in last two decades.
Interestingly, the ECP warned of such attacks much before the election process formally began. The ECP secretary in May this year told a parliamentary panel about the threat during a briefing.
Army Deployment
Besides providing security for transportation and storage of election material, it is for the first time that officials of the armed forces, mainly the Pakistan Army, have been deployed at all polling stations.Around 370,000 army personnel are performing election duty inside and outside the polling stations across the country. In addition 449,465 personnel of police and other law enforcement agencies are performing election duty.
Result Management System
The ECP is using Android-based mobile application called Results Transmission System (RTS) in this general election. The presiding officers will be required to enter polling results into the application along with the picture of FORM XIV which will transmit data to the ECP server in real-time.The presiding officer shall immediately take snapshot of the result of the count and, as soon as connectivity is available and it is practicable, electronically send it to the commission and the returning officer before sending the original documents under Section 90.
Results By 2 am
Another provision of law says the returning officers (ROs) would have to compile the provisional results before 2:00 am the day immediately following the polling day, and communicate these results electronically to the ECP.
NDMA Issued Alerts
The National Disaster Management Authority (NDMA) has issued alerts to the government agencies concerned and provincial disaster management authorities (PDMAs) for a possible flood in River Indus and heavy rains in different parts of the country.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

According to a statement issued on Tuesday said that heavy downpour is expected on July 25 and 26 across the country and directed the concerned department to carry out required arrangements.NDMA warned that low flood being observed in nullahs of Dera Ghazi Khan while flood likely to hid Ravi and Chenab during both days.
Earlier, Caretaker Minister of Information Syed Ali Zafar, in a video message, encourage people to cast their votes without any fear in the General Election today.
Caretaker Minister of Information Syed Ali Zafar says people should exercise their right to vote with full confidence in tomorrow’s election.#Elections2018 #ElectionPakistan 🇵🇰 pic.twitter.com/h5WCiuIZvk
— Govt of Pakistan (@pid_gov) July 24, 2018
“These are the most important elections in country’s history,” he said, adding that the caretaker government, the Election Commission of Pakistan, and other institutions have taken all measures to ensure that the elections are peaceful.
Related News:
Govt Urges Masses To Exercise National Duty Without Fear

CEC Stresses Nation To Exercise Right To Vote Today

column2: US Supports Free, Fair Elections In Pakistan: State Dept
column5:
Washington (July 25, 2018): The United States is monitoring the situation in Pakistan, a spokesperson for the Department of State said Tuesday night, just a few hours ahead of the commencement of the highly-anticipated general election 2018.
The State Dept spokesperson said that the US supports free and fair elections throughout the world, including in Pakistan.The State Department is continuing to monitor the situation in Pakistan on Election Day, the spokesperson said, adding that hundreds of thousands of Pakistani citizens will be casting their votes in the general election.Washington offers its support and encouragement to all Pakistani people in exercising their democratic right to cast their votes in a peaceful manner, the spokesperson stressed.
Related News:
Wants to see a peaceful, stable Pakistan: U.S. State Department

column2: Election Material Transported On Bikes in NA-127
column5:
Lahore (July 24, 2018): Despite all claims to the contrary made by the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP), instances of sheer mismanagement are being reported a day ahead of elections.
One such occurrence was reported from the NA-127 constituency where election materials were transported to polling stations through motorcycles. According to a media report, ballot boxes and other materials were transported without any proper security arrangements.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

A total of 371,388 security forces officials are being deployed for election duty.
The process of distributing polling material to the polling stations for election 2018 across the country has been completed.
ECP dispatched polling materials under strict security arrangements to presiding officers at all the polling stations.For this purpose, the election staffs have gathered at the designated places while a special sticker has also been issued to the vehicles carrying polling material.
The polling material includes electoral lists, bags to be used on polling day, screens to offer privacy to voters and stationery items.

column2: China Reject US Allegations Of Currency Manipulation
column5:
Beijing(July 24, 2018): China on Monday rejected accusations by US President Donald Trump that it was manipulating the yuan to give its exporters an edge, saying Washington appeared “bent on provoking a trade war”.
Trump launched his latest trade salvo on Friday, accusing China and the European Union of currency manipulation and saying he was ready to impose tariffs on all Chinese imports coming into the United States. While it does let market forces play a role, China keeps the yuan within a narrow trading band that its adjusts daily and is widely known to intervene, which has triggered past US allegations of manipulation, including from Trump.“As to the US being bent on provoking a trade war, China does not want a trade war but is not afraid of a trade war,” Geng said when asked about Trump’s threat to impose across-the-board tariffs on Chinese goods.
Related News:
NEPRA Increases Power Tariff By Rs0.50 Per Unit For June

In a tweet, a day before general elections in Pakistan on Tuesday, Malala urged the Pakistanis to get up, and exercise their right to vote. The people of Pakistan – especially women – the power is in your hands, she added.
The people of Pakistan – especially women – the power is in your hands. Get up, go and vote! Democracy shall win! #Election2018 🇵🇰🗳 pic.twitter.com/LqVRUK9cjO

column2: LEAs Arrest Five Accused, Fake Ballot Papers, Stamps Recovered
column5:
Umarkot (July 24, 2018): Rangers and Pak army have seized a stack of fake ballot papers and arrested five suspects in connection with the fraud in Umarkot.
According to details, rangers and Pak army has seized fake ballot papers, that were found hidden in a jeep near Pakistan Chowk in the town of Umarkot, and has arrested five suspects involved in this fraud. Ballot papers were to be delivered to the PS-52 constituency.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Fake ballot papers were found hidden in a jeep. According to rangers, five arrested suspects includes Anwar Soomro, Hakim, Iqbal, Kanghar, and Nawab.
Forces continue to put efforts for fair and free elections. Police are investigating the incident, after arrest of suspects.

ECP Finalizes All Arrangements To Hold Free, Fair Elections

General Election 2018: Key Contests Across The Country

column2: ECP Finalizes All Arrangements To Hold Free, Fair Elections
column5:
Islamabad (July 24, 2018): Electioneering by political parties for the general election ended last night, general polls to be held tomorrow.
Over 12,570 candidates are in the run for National Assembly and four provincial assemblies.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

However, the candidates are allowed to do door-to-door campaigning today.
According to the electoral rolls, 105.96 million voters are eligible to cast the vote.
Political leaders and contesting candidates made last ditch efforts through public gatherings, corner meetings and rallies to garner maximum public support.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

In all, 85,307 polling stations have been set up across the country.
As many as 450,000 policemen and three hundred thousand army troops have been deployed to ensure security on the polling day.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

It will be a public holiday tomorrow.
ECP has issued a code of the conduct for the candidates, who are contesting general polls.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Distribution of Polling Material to Polling Stations Begins
The process of distributing polling material to the polling stations for election 2018 across the country has begun today (Tuesday).
According to details, the concerning departments, under strict security arrangements, are dispatching the material to presiding officers at all the polling stations.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

For this purpose, the election staffs have gathered at the designated places while a special sticker has also been issued to the vehicles carrying polling material.
ECP Outlines Voting Method For General Elections 2018
The Election Commission of Pakistan has outlined the voting method for the General Election 2018 — to be held on July 25 across the country.
According to the electoral body, the ballot paper for National Assembly will be green, while white paper will be used for provincial Assemblies.
In the first stage of the polling process, the officer will check the voter’s national identity card. Following this, voter’s name will be checked in the voting list.
The polling agent will then call out the voter’s name and serial number. After the voter’s name is crossed out on the list, their thumb impression will be taken on counter files. The voter’s thumb will be marked with permanent ink.After the assistant presiding officer signs on the back of the ballot paper for the national and provincial assemblies, the voter will be issued the polling paper.
The voter will then move behind the voting screen to stamp on the candidates of their choice. The national assembly paper will then be inserted into the box with the green lid. A box with a white lid will be used to insert the ballot paper for the provincial assembly.
The polling process will start at 8am on July 25 and end at 6pm on the same day.Doors of the polling station will be closed after the voting time ends, however, any voters inside the polling station will still be allowed to cast their votes.
ECP Shows Details of Polling Stations Across The Country:
Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) informed that 85,307 polling stations in all the four provinces, Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) and the Federal Capital will be set up to facilitate voters and to ensure better turnout on the polling day.
According to the ECP, total 23,3585 male, 21,679 female, 40,236 combined and 156 improvised polling stations would be established across the country.The notification said that 47,813 polling stations would be set up in Punjab, 17,747 in Sindh, 12,634 in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, 4,420 in Balochistan, 797 in the Federal Capital and 1,896 in FATA.
The official further added some 360 male, 360 female and 77 combined polling stations would be established in the Federal Capital, 13,351 male, 12,716 female and 21,746 combined ones in Punjab, and 467 male, 359 female and 1,070 combined ones in FATA.Likewise, 1,252 male, 1073 female, 2,052 combined and 43 improvised polling stations would be set up in Balochistan, 4,128 male, 3,600 female and 4,906 combined ones in KP, and 3,866 male, 3,599 female and 10,288 combined ones in Sindh.
Earlier, the ECP had declared 17,007 polling stations as highly sensitive.As many as 5,878 of the polling stations declared as highly sensitive were from Sindh province, 5,487 from Punjab and Islamabad, 3,874 from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and FATA, and 1,768 from Balochistan.
PEMRA urges media houses to exhibit sobriety while covering elections
Pakistan Electronic Media Regulatory Authority has asked all media houses to exhibit sobriety while covering general election 2018.
In an advisory issued, PEMRA said all the licensees are obliged to follow code of conduct for political parties, contesting candidates, election and polling agents and code of conduct of media for general election issued by Election Commission of Pakistan.It said that it is obligatory on media to inform and educate public about relevant electoral matters and motivate them to cast their votes.
PEMRA said all broadcasters should ensure balanced and impartial coverage of the election without any discrimination to any party or candidate.
Emphasizing on tolerance, the advisory said it is the duty of all media houses to promote tolerance among the public and avoid all form of expressions that may incite violence on the basis of political affiliations, and religious beliefs.
It further informed that election campaign for general elections on electronic media shall come to an end with effect from midnight tonight.
ECP Releases Details, 1.6 Million Electoral Staff Will Be Deployed
The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) released details about the number of polling staff and security personnel that will be working on July 25.
The election management body stated that 1.6 million electoral staff will be working on Election Day.According to the ECP, there will be 449,465 policemen deployed on the day of the election out of which 202,100 will be posted in Punjab and Islamabad while 100,500 policemen will be stationed in Sindh.
In Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), 87,269 policemen will be on duty, according to the ECP.
Moreover, there will also be 300,071 army personnel will also be deployed across the country.The notification further states that there will two members of the army posted inside the polling station while two will be posted outside.
From the ECP staff, there will be 85,307 presiding officers on duty on July 25 — one at every polling station — with 510,356 assistant presiding officers and 255,178 polling officers on duty.
ECP Issues Guidelines For ROs About Compilation of Results
Election Commission of Pakistan(ECP) had dispatched letters to the returning officers about the preparation of election results.
According to the commission, the returning officers(ROs) will prepare form number forty-five after the counting of ballots which will contain details about the votes secured by the candidates.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Details about the unused ballot papers will be listed in form number forty-six.
Related News:
ECP Installs CCTV Cameras At Sensitive Pollings Of Hazara

Printing of Ballot Papers In Final Stages: ECP Meeting Told

column2: Met Department Predicts Rain on Election Day
column5:
Lahore: (July 24, 2018) The meteorological department has predicted widespread rain on election day, July 25, as the new spell of monsoon is expected to start in several parts of the country from Sunday.
Waves of monsoon have entered Pakistan from the Arabian Sea and Bengal therefore a new spell of rain and thunderstorms will hit Punjab, Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and other parts of the country, the Met office said.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

On the other hand, Director Local Government has written a letter to the ECP to avoid the mismanagement on election day.
Met announced that the rain will continue till the end of the week and can affect the process of polling.
In this connection, PDMA has appointed officers to deal with natural disasters and started work to monitor flood and sensitive buildings.
On the other hand, Director Local Government has written a letter to the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) to avoid mismanagement on election day.

column2: Election 2018 Campaign Across The Country Ends
column5:
Islamabad (July  24, 2018): The election campaign by political parties ended across the country for the General Polls, which will be held on Wednesday.
Political leaders and contesting candidates made last-ditch efforts through public gatherings, corner meetings and door to door campaigns to garner maximum public support.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

At the stroke of midnight, 24 hours before election day, all electioneering activities have been suspended by political parties in accordance with the Election Commission of Pakistan’s guidelines.
No party is allowed to hold any political gathering or corner meeting from 12.00am Tuesday till the elections are over, and all political activity will remain suspended until election results are formally announced.
Section 182 of Election Act 2017 states that no person shall convene, hold or attend any public meeting and no person shall promote or join in any procession within the area of the constituency during a period of 48 hours before polling.
Although all three major political parties had planned to culminate their campaigns with large political gatherings on Monday, the final day of electioneering seemed to lack colour and energy and concluded without much fanfare.
PML-N Ends Campaign in DG Khan
PML-N President Shahbaz Sharif addressed a big rally in Dera Ghazi Khan — where he is contesting for an NA seat.
Shehbaz Sharif claimed that his party will clean sweep in the elections despite all the “injustices”. He said that former prime minister Nawaz Sharif ended darkness in the country.He further said that the party has made Danish schools and cadet colleges in Dera Ghazi Khan, adding if he gets a chance then the PML-N will convert DI Khan into Lahore.
“Every party worker is pivotal to the party,” said the PML-N president.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

Former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, in his message from Adiala prison, Monday urged the masses to vote for Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) in July 25 polls.
PTI Ends Campain in Lahore
PTI Chairman Imran Khan addressed supporters at multiple places in Lahore — with large gatherings planned at Jallo Mor and Wapda Town — as party formally ended its campaign with the jalsa at Data Darbar.
Imran Khan on Monday lamented former Punjab Chief Minister Sharif family particularly Shehbaz Sharif and said he was acting more than playing in movies.Imran Khan made these views during his last stormy visit in provincial capital Lahore ahead of General Elections 2018.Imran Khan—who is sensing victory in elections 2018—deplored that residents of the provincial capital do not have access to clean water.
“Abid Boxer assassinated people at the behest of Shehbaz Sharif. The condition of schools in Lahore is deplorable”, added Khan.
Bilawal Ends Campaign At Bhutto Mausoleum
Pakistan People’s Party (PPP) chairman Bilawal Bhutto-Zardari ended his election campaign on Monday night by offering Fateha (prayers) at the Bhutto Mausoleum at Garhi Khuda Bakhsh.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

On Monday, Chairman PPP also visited Shahadkot, Garhi Khairi, Jacobabad, Shikarpur and Garhi Yasin. The PPP Chairman reiterated his party’s commitment to democracy.
“During my entire campaign, I have taken PPP’s Manifesto everywhere with me. The reason is simple: I want to let the people of Pakistan know what the PPP stands for. We believe in freedoms, democratic principles and we want the best for our nation,” said Bhutto.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

The PPP chief remarked how other parties only indulged in point-scoring and calling each other names while the PPP leadership actually raised issues related to the well-being of the people of Pakistan.“We have never resorted to name-calling. Such tactics are only used by those who don’t have anything substantial to say. I am here to serve my nation; nothing else matters. Fulfilling Shaheed Mohtarma Benazir Bhutto’s mission is my ultimate goal.” Chairman PPP said he believes in a progressive Pakistan.
According to ECP, over 12,570 candidates are in the run for seats of National and four provincial assemblies.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

Against the National Assembly’s seats, about 3,675 candidates are in the electoral race whereas about 8,895 for the provincial legislatures.
According to the data shared by the ECP, 1,696 candidates are vying for the National Assembly’s constituencies from Punjab and 4,242 for the provincial legislature.
From Sindh, 872 are contesting for the National Assembly seats and 2,382 for the provincial assembly.
Total contesting candidates for the National Assembly from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa are 760 and 1,264 for the provincial assembly.For Balochistan’s National Assembly seats, there are a total of 303 candidates and 1,007 for its provincial assembly seats.
In Islamabad, seventy-six candidates are in the race for three seats of National Assembly.
According to the electoral rolls, 105.96 million voters are eligible to cast the vote.
In all, 85,307 polling stations have been set up across the country.Over twenty thousand polling stations have been declared sensitive and CCTV cameras have been installed inside and outside all the sensitive polling stations.
450,000 policemen and three hundred thousand army troops will be deployed on the polling day.It will be public holiday on the election day whilst the ministry of water and power has also been directed by the election commission not to carry out loadshedding on the polling day.
Related News:
GE 2018: ECP’s Arrangements In Final Phase

ECP Warns To Nullify Polls in KP if Women Barred from Vote

column2: PML N To Win Despite of All “Injustices”: Shehbaz Sharif
column5:
Lahore (July 23, 2018): Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz President Shehbaz Sharif said on Monday that his party is winning despite all the “injustices”.
The PML-N leader was addressing a gathering in Basti Talpur, as a part of his ongoing election campaign for the upcoming polls on July 25.
He said that former prime minister Nawaz Sharif ended darkness in the country.
The PML-N president claimed that his party is winning certainly from centre and Punjab.
He further said that the party has made Danish schools and cadet colleges in Dera Ghazi Khan, adding if he gets a chance then the PML-N will convert DI Khan into Lahore.
The PML-N president also visited deceased party member Manzoor Chingwani’s home, where he offered condolences to the family members.
“Every party worker is pivotal to the party,” said the PML-N president, adding that Chingawani’s sacrifices for the party will be remembered.
Earlier, former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, in his message from Adiala prison, Monday urged the masses to vote for PML-N in July 25 polls.

The election campaign is going to end across the country at midnight tonight for the General Polls, which will be held on Wednesday.
Political leaders and contesting candidates are making last-ditch efforts through public gatherings, corner meetings and door to door campaigns to garner maximum public support.
Over 12,570 candidates are in the run for seats of National and four provincial assemblies.Against the National Assembly’s seats, about 3,675 candidates are in the electoral race whereas about 8,895 for the provincial legislatures.
According to the data shared by the ECP, 1,696 candidates are vying for the National Assembly’s constituencies from Punjab and 4,242 for the provincial legislature.
From Sindh, 872 are contesting for the National Assembly seats and 2,382 for the provincial assembly.

In Islamabad, seventy-six candidates are in the race for three seats of National Assembly.
According to the electoral rolls, 105.96 million voters are eligible to cast the vote.
In all, 85,307 polling stations have been set up across the country.Over twenty thousand polling stations have been declared sensitive and CCTV cameras have been installed inside and outside all the sensitive polling stations.
450,000 policemen and three hundred thousand army troops will be deployed on the polling day.It will be public holiday on the election day whilst the ministry of water and power has also been directed by the election commission not to carry out loadshedding on the polling day.

column2: Nawaz Urges Masses To Vote for PML-N In General Elections
column5:
Islamabad (July 23, 2018): Former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, in his message from Adiala prison, Monday urged the masses to vote for Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) in July 25 polls.
The audio message of the former premier was shared on his daughter Maryam Nawaz’s Twitter handle.
“I, Mohammad Nawaz Sharif, am speaking from the prison and the historic day of July 25 is just around the corner,” he said.“I am witnessing your passion while being incarcerated in the jail, and listening to ‘respect the vote’ chants everywhere.”
Nawaz through his recorded message urged masses to give a final push to the already “tumbling wall of flaws.”
قائد مسلم لیگ ن محمد نوازشریف کا الیکشن سے قبل قوم کے نام پیغام۔
25 جولائی کو اپنے حقوق کی آزادی اور ووٹ کی عزت کے لئے اٹھ کھڑے ہو، گھروں سے نکلو اور شیر پر مہر لگاؤ۔#PMLN 🐅#VoteKoIzzatDo #ووٹ_کو_عزت_دو pic.twitter.com/FREu2R6mFs

“I want to tell you that the time has come to give a final push to the already tumbling wall of flaws that have been destined on us for years,” he said.
“Change all of this now,” the former premier said, addressing people of his independent homeland, who he said had been “enslaved.”
Nawaz said that he and his daughter were incarcerated because of leading the campaign for the vote’s respect. “Maryam and I are incarcerated because we led this movement for your honour and respect of your vote.”“The time has come for you to make this movement a success, and announce such a historic verdict which may sweep all those verdicts away that have made Pakistan a graveyard of justice,” he urged the people.
“Set out of your homes after the Fajr prayers on July 25, with utmost resolve and determination, and vote for Muslim League-Nawaz for your dignity and sanctity of your vote.”The former premier urged the masses to “change the fate of the country”, reminding them of voting for ‘lion’ — his party’s electoral symbol.
“This is a golden chance, which you are being given by Almighty Allah and through this, you have to change the fate of Pakistan at any cost,” he said.

ECP Outlines Voting Method For General Elections 2018

column2: ECP Outlines Voting Method For General Elections 2018
column5:
Islamabad (July 23, 2018): The Election Commission of Pakistan has outlined the voting method for the General Election 2018 — to be held on July 25 across the country.
According to the electoral body, the ballot paper for National Assembly will be green, while white paper will be used for provincial Assemblies.
In the first stage of the polling process, the officer will check the voter’s national identity card. Following this, voter’s name will be checked in the voting list.
The polling agent will then call out the voter’s name and serial number. After the voter’s name is crossed out on the list, their thumb impression will be taken on counter files. The voter’s thumb will be marked with permanent ink.After the assistant presiding officer signs on the back of the ballot paper for the national and provincial assemblies, the voter will be issued the polling paper.
The voter will then move behind the voting screen to stamp on the candidates of their choice. The national assembly paper will then be inserted into the box with the green lid. A box with a white lid will be used to insert the ballot paper for the provincial assembly.
The polling process will start at 8am on July 25 and end at 6pm on the same day.Doors of the polling station will be closed after the voting time ends, however, any voters inside the polling station will still be allowed to cast their votes.
Earlier on last Friday, Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) informed that 85,307 polling stations in all the four provinces, Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) and the Federal Capital will be set up to facilitate voters and to ensure better turnout on the polling day.
According to the ECP, total 23,3585 male, 21,679 female, 40,236 combined and 156 improvised polling stations would be established across the country.The notification said that 47,813 polling stations would be set up in Punjab, 17,747 in Sindh, 12,634 in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, 4,420 in Balochistan, 797 in the Federal Capital and 1,896 in FATA.
The official further added some 360 male, 360 female and 77 combined polling stations would be established in the Federal Capital, 13,351 male, 12,716 female and 21,746 combined ones in Punjab, and 467 male, 359 female and 1,070 combined ones in FATA.Likewise, 1,252 male, 1073 female, 2,052 combined and 43 improvised polling stations would be set up in Balochistan, 4,128 male, 3,600 female and 4,906 combined ones in KP, and 3,866 male, 3,599 female and 10,288 combined ones in Sindh.
Earlier, the ECP had declared 17,007 polling stations as highly sensitive.As many as 5,878 of the polling stations declared as highly sensitive were from Sindh province, 5,487 from Punjab and Islamabad, 3,874 from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and FATA, and 1,768 from Balochistan.

column2: PPP Contesting Election Against Political Orphans: Bilawal
column5:
Qambar (July 23, 2018): Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari on Monday said that he would contest General Elections 2018 against ‘political orphans’.
Bilawal was addressing a corner meeting in Qambar district on the last day of election campaign.
“I am out on streets to save Pakistan,” said the PPP scion, urging voters to support him the same way they supported his grandfather and deceased PPP leader Zulfikar Ali Bhutto.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

The PPP chairman added that his party would fight elections against poverty and ignorance, while vowing to solve problems of the masses if elected to power.
PPP’s lawmakers would not sit in Karachi or Islamabad, added Bilawal.
They would sit in their respective constituencies to solve problems of the masses. PPP’s fight is against terrorists and terrorism in General Elections 2018”, stated Bhutto.
Bilawal is contesting elections from NA-8 (Malakand), NA-200 (Larkana) and NA-246 (Karachi South 1).
It would suffice here to mention that the deadline for election campaign will end tonight whereas polling for the much-awaited and much-anticipated historic elections will be held on July 25.
The election campaign by political parties will end across the country at midnight tonight for the General Polls, which will be held on Wednesday.Political leaders and contesting candidates are making last-ditch efforts through public gatherings, corner meetings and door to door campaigns to garner maximum public support.
Over 12,570 candidates are in the run for seats of National and four provincial assemblies.
Against the National Assembly’s seats, about 3,675 candidates are in the electoral race whereas about 8,895 for the provincial legislatures.
According to the data shared by the ECP, 1,696 candidates are vying for the National Assembly’s constituencies from Punjab and 4,242 for the provincial legislature.
From Sindh, 872 are contesting for the National Assembly seats and 2,382 for the provincial assembly.
Total contesting candidates for the National Assembly from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa are 760 and 1,264 for the provincial assembly.For Balochistan’s National Assembly seats, there are a total of 303 candidates and 1,007 for its provincial assembly seats.
In Islamabad, seventy-six candidates are in the race for three seats of National Assembly.
According to the electoral rolls, 105.96 million voters are eligible to cast the vote.
In all, 85,307 polling stations have been set up across the country.Over twenty thousand polling stations have been declared sensitive and CCTV cameras have been installed inside and outside all the sensitive polling stations.
450,000 policemen and three hundred thousand army troops will be deployed on the polling day.It will be public holiday on the election day whilst the ministry of water and power has also been directed by the election commission not to carry out load shedding on the polling day.

column2: Kamran Tessori Distances Himself From Election
column5:
Karachi (July 23, 2018): The former leader of Muttahida Qaumi Movement-Pakistan Kamran Tessori has announced that he would not contest the General Elections 2018 from any constituency.
Addressing press conference he said that the entire authority of the MQM-P falls under Khalid Maqbool Siddiqui.
“The responsibility for the results of July 25 polls will fall on the MQM-P,” said the disgruntled party member.Tessori alleged that the MQM-P members have taken decisions of their own choice, although adding in the same vein that he ‘doesn’t have any ideological differences with the party’.
“I don’t want to give any chance to the MQM-P Bahadurabad faction,” said Kamran Tessori.
The former MQM-P leader said that he has reservations over the census and delimitation of constituencies in Sindh.
Earlier, Tessori had announced to contest the elections as an independent candidate.

Future of Karachi Belongs To MQM-P: Amir Khan

Over Eight Lac Security Personnel Deployed For Election

column2: Over Eight Lac Security Personnel Deployed For Election
column5:
Islamabad (July 23, 2018): The interior ministry said that stringent security arrangements have been made and more than eight hundred thousand security personnel have been deployed across the country to guard the election 2018.
Ministry said that Pakistan Army and paramilitary forces are included in the election security contingency.
It also mentioned that despite heavy security, the reserve army personnel will also ready to cope with the emergency situation.High Alert in Punjab Hospitals
The department of health Punjab has given the high alert call to all teaching hospitals to cope the emergency situation during polling day. In its notification department has directed the teaching hospitals to make sure all the possible arrangements in this connection.
Personnel Being Sent to Interior Sindh
More than three thousands police personnel being sent to other parts of the Sindh and for the purpose, they have been called since morning at Garden headquarters, however after the passage of hours they are not being provided with any kind of lunch facility and proper sitting arrangements.Flag March in Multan
To make sure the security during the polling day, Multan police have made special arrangements. Police have conducted the flag march to increase the sense of better security in the minds of masses as SSP operations Tauseef Haider has led the flag march.
The police, Elliot force, Muhafiz Squad, Dolphin police and traffic police personnel participated in the march that marched through the MD Chowk, Chungi no 1, Ghanta Ghar and kechehri chowk.
People expressed their satisfaction over the security arrangements made by the city administration.
Related News:
GE 2018: ECP’s Arrangements In Final Phase

column2: Sheikh Rashid Challenges Postponement of NA-60 Polls
column5:
Rawalpindi (July 23, 2018): Awami Muslim League(AML) Chief Sheikh Rasheed on  Monday challenged the Election Commission of Pakistan’s (ECP) decision to postpone polling the city’s NA-60 constituency in Lahore High Court’s Rawalpindi Bench.
Submitting a petition through his counsel Sardar Abdul Razzaq, Rasheed has contended that election cannot be postponed due to the sentencing of a candidate.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Rasheed has mentioned in the petition that elections in the constituencies of PML-N’s Maryam Nawaz and Capt (retd) Safdar were not postponed when they were jailed in the Avenfield properties reference earlier this month.
The petition has named the ECP and relevant returning officer as respondents.
Earlier on Sunday, the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) postponed polls in NA-60, Rawalpindi constituency following Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) leader Hanif Abbasi’s sentence.
“The polling schedule for NA-60 will be issued later,” the ECP said. A special anti-narcotics court sentenced Abbasi to life in the ephedrine quota case late Saturday, just four days before the general election in the country.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Earlier on Saturday, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) leader Hanif Abbasi gets life term in Ephedrine case. The Control of Narcotics Substances (CNS) court on Saturday, while announcing its verdict in the ephedrine quota case, handed life imprisonment to PML-N leader Hanif Abbasi.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Abbasi was taken into custody from the courtroom after the judge announced the verdict. The supporters of PML-N leader did try to hinder Abbasi’s arrest and offered some resistance.
The PML-N leader will not be able to contest the upcoming general elections following the narcotics court’s decision.Abbasi, who is contesting the upcoming election from NA-60 Rawalpindi, faced charges of misusing 500kg of the controlled chemical ephedrine, which he obtained for his company, Gray Pharmaceutical, in 2010.
The court, in its verdict announced after 6 years, ruled that nearly 363 kilograms of ephedrine was rightly used. It said that Abbasi failed to provide evidence of the use of the remaining quantity of the drug.
Related News:
Rasheed Resolves To Challenge Postponement Of Polls In NA-60

Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf will show its power numbers in Lahore today to attract masses just before the election, which will be held on July 25.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Imran Khan will address at Data Darbar Chowk Lahore today.
#NA125YasminKa Waiting to honour Chairman @ImranKhanPTI at Data Darbar Chowk Lahore today on 23rd July#AbSirfImranKhan pic.twitter.com/TtTha691PZ

Later PTI Cheif will hold a jalsa in NA-134 today at Akbar Chowk, Wapda Town, Lahore.
Chairman @ImranKhanPTI will held a jalsa at #NA134 today on 23rd July at Akbar Chowk,WapdaTown Lahore#AbSirfImranKhan pic.twitter.com/viz8uxPQVw

— PTI (@PTIofficial) July 23, 2018
Earlier on Sunday, Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Chairman Imran Khan said that he was competing against the mafia, not politicians.
While addressing a public rally at Bagh-e-Jinnah, Imran said, “Zardari mafia has been ruling different parts of Sindh. The houses around Bilawal House were forcefully evacuated.”
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

He further added, “These people refer to the system in place in Sindh to be a democracy.” Lashing out at Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz leadership, Imran claimed that Punjab was forcefully occupied by the Sharif family.
“Abid ‘Boxer’ accepted that Shehbaz used to encourage him to engage in extrajudicial killings,” Imran alleged, adding that the Sharif family laundered money and took the country’s money abroad.The PPP and PML-N endorsed the charter of democracy just so they could engage in corrupt practices, Imran added.
Earlier, while addressing media upon arrival to Karachi, he remarked that the party reserves the right to put forward its manifesto while campaigning.
“Those who rigged elections last time are crying foul now.” The forthcoming General Election 2018 will prove to be “historical”, Imran Khan claimed.
He further shared that he held rallies in Bannu and Karak despite facing threats to life.  Earlier, he attended a ceremony of Karachi Chambers of Commerce.

column2: PTI Election Office Attacked, Two Injured
column5:
Faisalabad (July 23, 2018): Two PTI Workers got injured in an alleged attack by PML-N workers over PP-117 Election Office in Faisalabad.
According to the details, the incident took place in Al Masoom Town of the city, where reportedly PML-N workers attacked PTI’s election office over taking out a rally.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

As a result, two Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf(PTI) workers got injured.
Faisalabad: Clash Among PML-N, PTI Workers leaves Seven Injured
Earlier on July 20,  at least seven people, including a woman and two brothers, received bullet injuries after a clash among the activists of Pakistan Muslim League – Nawaz (PML-N) and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) in Faisalabad.
According to the details PML-N, PTI activists clash over the issues of installation of their party flags and displaying banners in constituency NA-106.
The victims’ families said that PML-N activists shoot and injured their beloved and escaped from the scene. The injured are identified as Bilal, Tousif, Khadim, Mansoor and Naseer. Rescue officials shifted the injured to nearby hospital.Earlier, at least five people received injuries including bullet wounds when workers of political rivals Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) came face to face here a few months ago.
Initial reports suggest that the sides clashed with each other over the construction of a road in Shahdara, area of Lahore. Sources said that three activists of PML-N and two of PTI received injuries. Rescue officials shifted the injured to the hospital. Later, PTI hold protest demonstration at GT road against PML-N

column2: 20 Injured in Grenade Attack On BAP’s Election Office
column5:
Quetta (July 23, 2018): At least 20 people have been injured in a hand grenade attack on an election office of Balochistan Awami Party in Dalbandin, police said.
The injured have been shifted to hospitals in Chaghi and Quetta.
According to details, unknown people hurled a hand grenade outside the BAP’s office and fled away.
This was the third attack on an election-related activity in Pakistan within 12 hours.Earlier in the day, PTI candidate Israrullah Gandapur was killed when a suicide bomber hit his vehicle in Dera Ismail Khan.
Former chief minister Akram Durrani’s rally also came under firing in Bannu.

column2: Rasheed Resolves To Challenge Postponement Of Polls In NA-60
column5:
Rawalpindi (July 22, 2018): Awami Muslim League (AML) Chief Sheikh Rasheed on Sunday decided to move court against Election Commission of Pakistan’s (ECP) decision to postpone elections in NA-60 constituency following the disqualification of Hanif Abbasi in ephedrine case.
Rasheed held the stance that elections can only be postponed in case of death of candidate. He saw conspiracy behind postponement of elections.While terming decision of postponing unconstitutional, Rasheed stated that decision is tantamount to pre-poll rigging.
Earlier today,the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) postponed polls in NA-60, Rawalpindi constituency on Sunday following Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) leader Hanif Abbasi’s sentence.“The polling schedule for NA-60 will be issued later,” the ECP said. A special anti-narcotics court sentenced Abbasi to life in the ephedrine quota case late Saturday, just four days before the general election in the country.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

The PML-N leader was taken into custody from the courtroom soon after the judge announced the verdict.Earlier today, dozens of PML-N workers staged a protest at 6th Road in Rawalpindi against Abbasi’s life sentence. The protest was led by Senator Chaudhry Tanvir and Sardar Naseem.
Addressing a press conference, Senator Tanvir said, “We reject the court verdict against Abbasi.”  “We are going to file a petition requesting a delay in polls in NA-60, Rawalpindi constituency from which Abbasi was contesting the upcoming election,” he added.The PML-N leader further announced that they will stage a protest on a daily basis outside Abbasi’s office. Abbasi, who was contesting the upcoming election from NA-60 Rawalpindi, was accused of misusing 500kg of the controlled chemical ephedrine, which he obtained for his company, Gray Pharmaceutical, in 2010.
Yesterday, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) leader Hanif Abbasi gets life term in Ephedrine case. The Control of Narcotics Substances (CNS) court on Saturday, while announcing its verdict in the ephedrine quota case, handed life imprisonment to PML-N leader Hanif Abbasi.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

Abbasi was taken into custody from the courtroom after the judge announced the verdict. The supporters of PML-N leader did try to hinder Abbasi’s arrest and offered some resistance.
The PML-N leader will not be able to contest the upcoming general elections following the narcotics court’s decision.Abbasi, who is contesting the upcoming election from NA-60 Rawalpindi, faced charges of misusing 500kg of the controlled chemical ephedrine, which he obtained for his company, Gray Pharmaceutical, in 2010.
The court, in its verdict announced after 6 years, ruled that nearly 363 kilograms of ephedrine was rightly used. It said that Abbasi failed to provide evidence of the use of the remaining quantity of the drug.The ephedrine case surfaced in March 2011 when the then federal minister Makhdoom Shahabuddin told the National Assembly that the government would investigate the alleged allocation of 9,000 kilogrammes of ephedrine to two pharmaceutical companies — Berlex Lab International and Danas Pharmaceutical Limited.According to the rules, a company cannot be allocated more than 500kg of the drug, a limit fixed by the International Narcotics Control Board (INCB).
Earlier, security has been put on high alert on the back entrance to the anti-narcotics court. An armoured personnel carrier (APC) is also present on the spot. Personnel of the Anti-Narcotics Force and police have closed the way leading out of the court.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video:

Earlier, a Control of Narcotics Substances Court (CNSC), Rawalpindi, judge Muhammad Akram Khan reserved judgment in ephedrine case against Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz leader Hanif Abbasi.
The decision was reserved after his lawyer completed arguments in the court where the accused was also present. The judge said he would pronounced the judgement within the next three to four hours.A day earlier, Judge Mohammad Akram Khan rejected Abbasi’s plea to delay the trial’s deadline, noting that it has to follow orders of the Lahore High Court (LHC).
The judge also remarked that he will continue hearing arguments into the night if it takes that long.
Related News:
Sheikh Rasheed Meets Imran

FIR Lodged Against Sheikh Rasheed

column2: Gandapur’s Assassination: Election Postponed In PK-99
column5:
DI Khan (July 22, 2018): The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) has decided to postpone the forthcoming elections in PK-99 constituency after the assassination of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf’s (PTI) candidate Ikramullah Khan Gandapur today.
Ikramullah Gandapur, who was the PTI’s candidate from PK-99, succumbed to his injuries at the hospital after being injured in a blast near his vehicle in Tehsil Kalachi on Sunday.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Ikramullah was shifted to District Headquarters Hospital, DI Khan for treatment, where he succumbed to his injuries. The earlier blast claimed lives of Ikramullah Khan’s driver, while five others sustained injuries.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Click Play Button To Watch This Video
The former agriculture minister in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa was contesting the July 25 polls from PK-99, Kalachi.

Ikramullah’s brother, Israrullah Gandapur, was killed in a suicide bombing in 2013 in Kalachi.
Attacks Over Ikram Gandapur, Akram Durrani Condemned
Earlier today, Chairman Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf, Imran Khan has strongly condemned attack over party candidate, Ikramul Khan Gandapur.
In a tweet message, PTI Chairman Strongly condemned the attack and termed it as a cowardly act, Khan also prayed for the early recovery of the injured in the attack.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

On the other hand, Chairman PPP, Bilawal Bhutto Zardari and Co-Chairman of the PPP also strongly condemned the attacks over MMA’s Akram Durrani and PTI’s Ikramul Gandapur.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Both demanded of the caretaker government to provide security to the candidates, who are contesting elections and immediate arrest of the attackers.

column2: PML N To Win 2018 Elections With Clear Majority: Saad
column5:
Lahore (July 21, 2018): Former Federal Minister for Railways and senior PML N leader Khuwaja Saad Rafiq said that PML N is hopeful to win 2018 election with clear majority.
Addressing press conference in Lahore, Saad Rafiq said that people have positive attitude towards Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

He said that the negative attitude with PML N Quaid Nawaz Sharif and his daughter Maryam Nawaz has created sympathy for PML N.
He said that people will cast vote in upcoming elections on the basis of ideology.
Saad urged the Election Commission of Pakistan to take notice of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf’s election campaigning expenses.Calling into question the opposing party’s campaign splurge, Rafique wondered about the electioneering expenses incurred by the Imran Khan-led PTI in the run-up to the general elections.
“Within a single [day], PTI is putting up 30,000 posters [everywhere],”
The former railways minister slammed PTI for its “politics of abuse” and said the party would gain nothing from using foul language to target its opponents.
Rafique said that the PML-N’s vote bank in Punjab remained unaffected despite the conspiracies aimed at the party.Regarding the general elections, he said the PML-N accepts the authority of the presiding officers deployed at the polling stations on July 25.
He further said the media should be allowed access up to the polling stations on the election day, in order to ensure the polls are conducted in a transparent, free and fair manner.

Saad Rafique, Other PML-N Leaders Detained

My Constituency Altered For Ladla: Saad Rafique

According to details, 210 million ballot papers have been printed for national and provincial assemblies.

The polling process will start at 8am on July 25 and end at 6pm on the same day.Doors of the polling station will be closed after the voting time ends, however, any voters inside the polling station will still be allowed to cast their votes.
Earlier on Friday, Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) informed that 85,307 polling stations in all the four provinces, Federally Administered Tribal Areas (FATA) and the Federal Capital will be set up to facilitate voters and to ensure better turnout on the polling day.
According to the ECP, total 23,3585 male, 21,679 female, 40,236 combined and 156 improvised polling stations would be established across the country.The notification said that 47,813 polling stations would be set up in Punjab, 17,747 in Sindh, 12,634 in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, 4,420 in Balochistan, 797 in the Federal Capital and 1,896 in FATA.
The official further added some 360 male, 360 female and 77 combined polling stations would be established in the Federal Capital, 13,351 male, 12,716 female and 21,746 combined ones in Punjab, and 467 male, 359 female and 1,070 combined ones in FATA.Likewise, 1,252 male, 1073 female, 2,052 combined and 43 improvised polling stations would be set up in Balochistan, 4,128 male, 3,600 female and 4,906 combined ones in KP, and 3,866 male, 3,599 female and 10,288 combined ones in Sindh.
Earlier, the ECP had declared 17,007 polling stations as highly sensitive.As many as 5,878 of the polling stations declared as highly sensitive were from Sindh province, 5,487 from Punjab and Islamabad, 3,874 from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and FATA, and 1,768 from Balochistan.
All the political parties are busy in their election campaigns to attract the voters towards their manifestos so that they can bag the victory on July 25.
Related News:
Send SMS On 8300 To Know About Your Polling Station

Terror Threats: ECP Directs Provinces To Enhance Security

column2: Shahbaz Asks Voters To Bury PTI’s Politics Of Allegations
column5:
Faisalabad (July 21, 2018):Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) president Shahbaz Sharif on Friday said that the people will vote for PML-N to bury Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) politics forever.
Addressing a public meeting in Faisalabad in connection with PML-N election campaign, Shahbaz Sharif said that PTI chief Imran Khan only knows to blame others.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Shehbaz unleashed a verbal onslaught against his opponents while calling PTI chairman Imran Khan as ‘Bohtan Khan’. Shahbaz Sharif claimed that the caretaker government and Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf are two sides of the same coin.
He said that under the leadership of former prime minister Muhammad Nawaz Sharif, PML-N government overcame energy crisis, constructed motorways and launched China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) project. The PML-N government had also credit to make Pakistan an atomic power, he added.He said that when PML-N came into power in 2013, the country was facing severe load-shedding and menace of terrorism, but the government eliminated terrorists’ network and restored peace in the country.
The PML-N government established hospitals, universities, colleges, and completed mega development projects, he said and added, “We have also initiated power projects and added 11000 megawatt electricity into the national grid.”He claimed that Faisalabad was a citadel of PML-N and its people would vote and support PML-N on July 25. He pledged the PML-N, after coming into power, would bring Pakistan at par with Turkey and Malaysia in terms with development.
Earlier, addressing workers convention in Swat, President Pakistan Muslim league Nawaz Shehbaz Sharif criticized Imran Khan and said that he is Buhutan Khan
Shehbaz said that Peshawar metro project is complete disaster.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Before Swat workers convention, Shehbaz addressed a news conference after offering condolences to Bilour family in Peshawar, President Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz and former Chief Minister Punjab Shehbaz Sharif said that real progress is not possible without perpetual peace.
Sharif unleashed a verbal onslaught against his opponents while calling PTI chief Imran Khan as ‘Bhutan Khan’.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Shehbaz Sharif said that Nawaz Sharif has always scarified as leader. He said that Nawaz left his ailing wife in hospital and came here along with his daughter Maryam but the caretaker government did not treat them well.
He said that free and fair elections are vital for the country. He said that it is very important to respect vote and pre poll rigging can not benefit anyone.
Shehbaz expressed hope that his party will win in 2018 elections and continue serving Nation.He promised Nation to make Pakistan a very strong, prosperous country.
He alleged that the interim Punjab government is following orders of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI).
The former Punjab chief minister said the province’s caretaker government was supporting PTI. “Punjab’s interim government is dancing to the tunes of PTI, while the Election Commission of Pakistan continues to be a quiet bystander,” he said.
The PML-N president further alleged that the Proceedings of anti-graft body, National Accountability Bureau (NAB), were only being conducted to ‘push PML-N against the wall’.However, expressing confidence in his party’s standing with the voters, Shehbaz said PML-N was due to win the General Election 2018 if it is free and fair.
“Nobody attended Imran Khan’s rally in Lahore yesterday,” he said, “but despite heavy rainfall in Attock, PML-N’s rally was attended by a huge crowd.”
The PML-N president vowed to make Pakistan similar to Islamic countries Turkey and Malaysia if given a chance by the public in the upcoming polls.“Imran neither established schools or colleges nor forensic labs. A private hospital [Rehman Institute] was established in Peshawar and a picture of it was circulated [by Imran] to take credit. Now, is that not a lie? How will the country absorb this fraud?” Shehbaz said.
Continuing to lash out at his party’s political rival, the PML-N president said PTI had destroyed the entire of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) president Shehbaz Sharif on Friday said that no difference exists between the caretaker government and Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI).
He claimed of victory in the upcoming general elections 2018 scheduled to be held on July 25.
Related News:
Shehbaz Criticizes Imran, Calls Him “Buhutan Khan”

Progress Not Possible Without Perpetual Peace: Shehbaz

column2: US, EU Ambassadors Calls On ECP Secretary
column5:
Islamabad (July 20, 2018): Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) has briefed European Union (EU) and US ambassadors on Friday over general elections.
According to details, European Union (EU) and US ambassadors called on ECP Secretary  Babar Yaqoob Fateh Muhammad in election commission.
ECP secretary and ambassadors also discussed the code of conduct of the foreign observers in general elections.Earlier Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) released details on Friday about the number of polling staff and security personnel that will be working on July 25.
The election management body stated that 1.6 million electoral staff will be working on Election Day.
According to the ECP, there will be 449,465 policemen deployed on the day of the election out of which 202,100 will be posted in Punjab and Islamabad while 100,500 policemen will be stationed in Sindh.
In Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KP), 87,269 policemen will be on duty, according to the ECP.
Moreover, there will also be 300,071 army personnel will also be deployed across the country.
Related News:
Around 85 Thousand Polling Stations To Be Set Up: ECP

Expired CNICs To Be Valid For Vote in Elections: NADRA

column2: Expired CNICs To Be Valid For Vote in Elections: NADRA
column5:
Islamabad (July 20, 2018): National Database and Registration Authority (NADRA) on Friday said that Voters in possession of expired identity cards are also eligible to cast votes.
A high-level meeting of the National Database and Registration Authority (NADRA) was held in Islamabad and was presided over by its Chairman Usman Mobeen.The meeting took decisions regarding on-time printing of computerized national identity cards and their delivery before July 25, to continue printing process 24 hours a day and opening of NADRA offices across the country.
The offices will remain open on Saturday and Sunday and even on Election Day till 02:00pm.
The meeting decided to print all CNICs including those of normal category on urgent basis in view of the upcoming elections on July 25.The participants were told that all applications for new CNICs received before July 16 are being processed expeditiously, whereas, NADRA is not confiscating the old cards of the applicants since July 16.
The authority has directed courier companies concerned to ensure the dispatch of ID cards on weekends too.
Related News:
Printing of Ballot Papers Completed in Sindh: SEC

ECP Releases Details, 1.6 Million Electoral Staff Will Be Deployed

Swat (July 20, 2018): President Pakistan Muslim league Nawaz Shehbaz Sharif criticized Imran Khan and said that he is Buhutan Khan
Addressing workers convention in Swat, Shehbaz said that Peshawar metro project is complete disaster.
