CEC Urges to Create Awareness Vote Importance Among People

Abdul Ghaffar Soomro takes oath as Acting CEC

column2: SC Registrar Returns Imran Petition Against Election Act 2017
column5:
Islamabad (November 10, 2017): Registrar Office of Supreme Court of Pakistan on Friday returned Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Chairman Imran Khan’s petition against the Election Reforms Act 2017.
The apex court’s registrar returned the petition by raising objection over it.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

While returning the petition, the Registrar office said that the petitioner must approach the appropriate forum first.
The Registrar Office observed that without going to the concerned forum first petition cannot be filed directly in the apex court.
It is to be mentioned here that the PTI chief has filed a petition under Article 184/3 of the Constitution in the apex court against the Election Reforms Act 2017.Khan argued that the amendments in the Act are in violation of the constitution as a disqualified legislator cannot become the chief of a political party.
By passing an amendment to the law, which generally pertains to the holding of polls in the country, the ruling party had allowed ousted prime minister Nawaz Sharif to regain leadership of the party. The PTI leader added that the Act is against the Political Parties Order 2002, and in direct conflict with Article 204 and 175 of the Constitution.The petition said that the former prime minister had to resign from his position as party leader after the verdict of the Panama Papers case disqualified him from parliament.
Khan appealed to the court to eliminate Articles 9, 10 and 203 of Election Reforms Act, as he believed that these amendments were put forward to provide Nawaz with the constitutional cover he needed to become party chief again.
The intra-party election of Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) was held after the National Assembly passed the Elections Bill 2017 and this allowed Nawaz to regain the chairmanship of the ruling party.
Related News
CJP Constitutes Bench to Hear NAB Appeal in Hudaibia Case

Court Rejects Hijazi’s Plea for Acquittal in Record Tempering Case

column2: MQM-P Announces To Continue “Fly Kite” in Next Election
column5:
Karachi (November 9, 2017): The Rabbitta Committee of Mutahida Qaumi Movement has expressed full confidence in Farooq Sattar leadership and vowed that MQM will continue working as independent party and will contest with its own symbol and manifesto in next elections.
This was announced by the leader of MQM Pakistan Deputy Convener Kanwar Naveed Jameel, who was addressing press conference after concluding party’s Coordination Committee meeting in the absence of party head Farooq Sattar.
“Some members had expressed their reservations and we had to clear them,” he shared.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

He said that three important decisions were made during the meeting. First is that MQM’s name, flag, election symbol and manifesto will remain intact, he said.
“MQM would stay the same as it was, political alliances are formed quite often and there is nothing extra ordinary regarding it,” he claimed, adding it has nothing to do with MQM’s integrity.
He also stated examples of political alliances in the past, such as the Islami Jamhoori Ittehad and the Pakistan National Alliance.
The members also decided that MQM will contest the elections on the seats they had won earlier. Moreover, the party leadership has shown trust in the leadership of Sattar.“We have a united stance that we want Sattar to lead us.”
He also said: “We have asked our voters, supporters and workers to not believe in any rumours they hear on the media or otherwise.”
A day ago, Addressing اa joint press conference, after forming alliance with the PSP, MQM-P head said that both parties have decided to establish joint political alliance for not only urban Sindh but other parts of the province as well.
“MQM, PSP will contest next election on a one symbol, one party and one manifesto,” Farooq Sattar said.
Farooq Sattar said MQM-P hosting the press conference welcomed PSP leaders and workers.He said the main and first purpose of the conference to stop division of votes of Sindh urban areas.
“MQM will strongly oppose political torture and will tried to restore peace in the city,” he said.
“The people speaking languages other than Urdu will also be invited to join the alliance that will pave the way to establish peace in the country,” he mentioned.
“Pakistan, the province of Sindh and Karachi have been besieged in many crises. In particular, the parties active in Karachi and Sindh have felt that we not only have to address problems concerning Karachi and Sindh, but also those that concern the wider country,” Sattar said.
Cracks in MQM Appeared
Ali Raza Abidi Quit: As the aftershock of Mutahida Qaumi Movement Pakistan (MQM-P) and Pakistan Sirzameen Party (PSP) joining hands, the member national assembly of MQM-P Ali Raza Abidi left the party and announced the resignation from National Assembly seat.The announcement came shortly after the MQM-P and PSP decided to regroup with “one name, one symbol and one manifesto”, a year after the two political factions announced complete disassociation from their former leadership based in London.
Another senior leader, Amir Khan also rejected the merger of MQM with PSP.
He vowed, “I stick with the party symbol kite and name of MQM,” while talking to media at Karachi airport after his arrival form Dubai.
He restrained the party workers to reach airport and told them he will meet them after reaching central office.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Earlier, party members had shared that party head Farooq Sattar won’t be attending the party’s high-level huddle. Kamran Tessori, while speaking to the media, had announced that Sattar won’t be chairing the session. Instead, Rabita Committee Kanwar Naveed Jamil is presiding over the session, he said.
An official statement from the party stated that Sattar is not in attendance due to “personal commitments.”
According to sources, Sattar decided to skip the session due to internal pressure from some of the party members, who threatened to leave the party if Sattar headed it.
Many other members tried to convince Sattar to not succumb to the pressure as it would create a negative image in the media, said sources, but Sattar still chose to skip it.
A consultative meeting of party leaders was summoned on Thursday afternoon to address reservations of its disgruntled leaders on the recently-held joint press conference with Pak Sarzameen Party Chairman Mustafa Kamal.
Related News:
MNA Raza Abidi Quits MQM-P, Resign from NA Seat

MQM-P, PSP Join Hands To Become “Muttahida” Again

column2: No Impact of MQM-PSP Alliance on PPP: Murad Ali Shah
column5:
Karachi (November 09, 2017): Sindh Chief Minister Murad Ali Shah has downplayed the latest move of MQM-P and PSP to get united and contest next election under ‘one name, one symbol and one party’ saying that it will not have any impact on Pakistan People’s Party.
Talking to media at Expo Centre, the chief minister said that they (MQM-P and PSP) were suffering from confusion.Shah said that they themselves did not know who would be leading them.  He said that law and order situation of Karachi had improved a lot.
“After the merger, we will know who will be the leader. No one knows who the leader of the alliance is,” he said.
(MQM-P) has summoned a consultative meeting of party leaders today to address reservations of its leaders over move to join hands with Pak Sarzameen Party.
Related News:
MQM-P, PSP Join Hands To Become “Muttahida” Again

MNA Raza Abidi Quits MQM-P, Resign from NA Seat

column2: Imran Khan Reiterates Call for Early Elections
column5:
Chitral (November 09, 2017): Chairman Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Imran Khan has reiterated his call for early elections, saying that he sees no other way out except fresh polls of the current mess the country is in.
Talking to media in Chitral, the PTI chief said that when the mandate of a part become suspicious then early elections is called and this is the practice across the world.
Terming his call for early elections well within the democratic confines, Khan said that early elections were called in Japan, Turkey, UK and elsewhere.Harshly criticizing Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi for what ‘trying to save a corrupt, disqualified and money launderer’ former Prime Minister the PTI chief said that the country was passing through a crisis and the Prime Minister was in Manchester for what he claimed to business dealing of his private airline.The PTI chief said that the days of corrupt mafia was numbered, adding that he was fighting corruption for the last 21 years.
To a question regarding the expected merger of MQM-P and PSP, Imran said that there was no conspiracy behind the merger.
He said that the merger was PSP and MQM-P’s own issue and not theirs’.Imran Khan also harshly criticized Punjab Chief Minister Shahbaz Sharif, saying that the people of the province were facing problems due to the dense smog but the chief minister was in UK to persuade his bother to let him take over the party and rein of powers.
Related News:
Imran Khan Reaction on SC Verdict

PTI Chairman Imran Khan Addresses Rally in Chitral

column2: MQM, PSP Alliance: Musharraf Vows To Form Grand Alliance
column5:
Karachi (November 8, 2017): The former President and head of All Pakistan Muslim League (APML)  Pervez Musharraf hailed Mutahida Qaumi Movement (MQM) and Pakistan Sirzameen Party (PSP) alliance and termed it welcome step in Karachi politics and vowed that his party will form grand alliance in Sindh.
In his reaction over the alliance of MQM-P and PSP, Pervez Musharraf said that he was glad to see unity of Muhajir nation in shape of MQM and PSP alliance, however they should move forward to promote the ideology of Pakistan first.
پرویزمشرف کا اہم ترین ویڈیو پیغام پورے پاکستان کی مہاجر قوم کو مبارکباد ہمیں قومیت سے نکل کر پاکستانیت کا سوچنا ہے
پارٹ ٢@P_Musharraf pic.twitter.com/4VLNIrv1Ha
— APML (Official) (@APMLOfficial_) November 8, 2017
“PPP can be defeated in Sindh by setting up grand alliance and All Pakistan Muslim League (APML) will soon bring a strong political party after making political alliance,” he said.Musharraf reaction came over Mutahida Qaumi Movement Pakisan (MQM-P) and Pakistan Sirzameen Party (PSP) joining hands to avoid splitting of Muhajir vote.
“MQM, PSP will contest next election on a one symbol, one party and one manifesto,” Farooq Sattar said.
Farooq Sattar said MQM-P hosting the press conference welcomed PSP leaders and workers.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

He said the main and first purpose of the conference to stop division of votes of Sindh urban areas.
“MQM will strongly oppose political torture and will tried to restore peace in the city,” he said.
Earlier, All Pakistan Muslim League (APML) leader Mohammad Amjad Wednesday said if the Muttahida Qaumi Movement-Pakistan (MQM-P) and Pak Sarzameen Party (PSP) become part of their alliance, then Pervez Musharraf may assume the role of [their] leader.
The announcement came shortly before the MQM-P and PSP formally announced regrouping with “one name, one symbol and one manifesto”, a year after the two political factions announced complete disassociation from their former leadership based in London.
Speaking at a press conference here, Amjad recounted that Musharraf had advised [them] to work together and change the name of the MQM, and serve everyone including ‘Mohajirs.’
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

“Musharraf conveyed this message before and it is still there today,” he said, adding that doing so will help the MQM get into the national fold.
The APML leader said Musharraf was offered to lead the MQM in the past, but he declined to assume leadership of the MQM and PSP.
“They (MQM and PSP) should change their respective names and form a new party,” Amjad suggested. “Everyone knows what compelled the two parties to unify today.”
“If they become part of our alliance, then Musharraf may assume role of [their] leader,” he said.On October 23, chief of All Pakistan Muslim League (APML) Gen (retd) Pervez Musharraf had announced to return to Pakistan before next general elections.
Addressing a ceremony of opening the APML’s office of Karachi Central in FC Area Liaquatabad via telephone from Dubai, the former president said that country needs a third force and we shall expel the thieves and those who plundered Pakistan from politics.
He said that honest leadership will win with the support of the people. “Meetings will be held in Karachi Central and other areas. Pakistan’s future is bright,” he added.
Related News:
Will Return to Pakistan Before General Elections: Musharraf

MQM-P’s Rauf Siddiqui Meets Musharraf in Dubai

column2: PML-N Bound To Accept All Decisions of Nawaz: Shahbaz
column5:
Lahore (November 7, 2017): Punjab chief minister (CM) Shahbaz Sharif has said on Tuesday that Nawaz Sharif, ousted premier of Pakistan, is the leader of Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) and whatever decisions he takes in whichever situation, the party would accept it.
Speaking to the media after inaugurating a kidney transplant facility in Lahore on Tuesday, he said the opponents have not been able to prove corruption of even a single penny against the ruling Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) and the Sharif family.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

Criticizing Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) Co-chairman Asif Ali Zardari, Shahbaz Sharif said that he was involved in the embezzlement of Rs6 billion of tax-payers’ money and urged him to refrain from issuing suggestive statements.
He declared the government of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province a failure by saying that those who have called for premature General Elections 2018 have not delivered on their promises to the people of the province.
Had PML-N been in power in KP province, there would have been hospitals erected there as well, like those in Punjab, CM Shahbaz added.
Clearing questions about his relation with former interior minister Chaudhry Nisar Ali Khan, the chief minister said that the Chakri politician is his good friend and that he would be invited to inaugurate the facility once constructed.While talking about the scam involving multiple companies in Punjab, the chief minister said that he would let out details about the issue in coming days. He said that Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf chairman Imran Khan is not appearing before courts in defamation suit after wrongly accusing him of Rs 10 billion worth of corruption.
He asserted that Khan is calling for premature elections only to see Orange Line Train remain an incomplete project.
He alleged PTI of attempting to devoid Punjab of the development that is underway on multiple fronts after leaving Khyber Pakhtunkhwa disappointed.
He also talked about the ongoing smog issues in the province and admitted that the precautionary measures that were to be taken were ignored.
The chief minister said that Mr. Niazi of NICL is among those people who are named in Paradise Leak. He further said that there are ‘many characters’ in play in Paradise Leak.Punjab chief minister concluded his media talk by saying that the allegations against co-chairman of Pakistan People’s Party and former president of Pakistan Asif Ali Zardari are not mere accusations but the truth about him.
In the present situation, only PML-N is being tried in the accountability dock whereas investigations amount to accountability only if the parametres are the same for all the political parties.
While talking about Kidney and Liver Transplant Centre, CM Shahbaz said that the first phase of the facility would be constructed by December 25th and that the institute comprises of at least 360 beds.
In an apparent attempt to tone down reports of power tussle between Sharif brothers, Shahbaz said he would abide by all decisions of his elder brother Nawaz Sharif – the deposed prime minister who is also the ruling party’s chairman.In high-level party huddle in London last month, the ousted premier was reportedly unhappy with the Punjab CM and his son Hamza Shababz’s cold response to the reconciliation efforts of his daughter Maryam Nawaz.
During the meetings in London, Shahbaz was said to have minced no words in assuring his elder brother that he always stood by his side and would continue to do so, but also said that the way loyalists were marginalised in the party at the expense of promoting the ‘paratroopers’ was costing the PML-N dearly.
The former prime minister was further urged by his younger brother that he needed to differentiate between those who sacrificed for the party in the past to keep it intact and those who brought the party to the point where it was today — on the verge of isolation.
The elder Sharif reportedly sounded unhappy mentioning that senior cabinet members and party leaders were openly criticising his policies and putting their weight behind his younger brother.
Related News:
Shahbaz Name Finalized for PM as Nawaz Sharif Alternative

abbtakk.tv/en/nawaz-shahbaz-resolve-to-foil-conspiracies-jointly/

column2: PTI Challenges NA-120 By-poll Results in ECP
column5:
Lahore (November 7, 2017): The leader of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaaf (PTI) and runner up candidate from NA-120 constituency Yasmeen Rashid challenged NA-120 by-poll results in Election commission of Pakistan and alleged that large scale rigging was done during the by -poll.
The PML-N candidate Begum Kalsoom Nawaz had won the by poll of NA-120 defeating PTI candidate Yasmeen Rashid with difference of about 15000 votes on September 17.Talking to media after filing her petition in ECP, PTI leader said that PTI had filed plea against the unidentified 29000 votes and Lahore High Court sought list of mentioned voters list, however ECP had provided incomplete list on which PTI protested and demanded complete list.
” ECP had not paid any attention and provided incomplete documents before the by poll, however after assessment it was found that 30 percent of voters outside the country and other 30 percent voters were dead,” she explained adding that some voters listed twice and all evidences have been provided to ECP.She continued saying that despite objections raised by the PTI polling agents suspect voters were allowed to cast their votes as more then 32 petition have been filed over violation of EC code of conduct.
Related News:
NA 120 Victory Proved ‘Whole Country is Nawaz’s Fort’: Shahbaz

ECP Issues Notification of Kalsoom Nawaz Success from 120

column2: PPP Does Not Support Call for Early Elections: Khursheed Shah
column5:
Islamabad (November 6, 2017): Senior Pakistan Peoples Party figure and Opposition Leader in the National Assembly (NA) Khursheed Shah said on Monday that his party has not taken a U-turn on the issue of delimitation of constituencies of the NA.
Speaking to the media, Shah said they have raised questions over the provisional results of the latest population count in Sindh.
He added that the PPP has no issues if the next general elections are held on the basis of the 1998 census results.
However, the elections should be held on time, he said further.
Shah also explained that the PPP does not support the call for early elections in the country.
Talking about former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, Shah said Nawaz knows who his enemy is, adding that, his [Nawaz] close associates are conspiring against him.
The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) has been advocating early elections in the country.
Moreover, the Parliament is yet to pass a bill which will fulfil legal requirements for holding elections next year in light of the latest census.The PTI and PPP, among other parties, want the delimitations bill to be discussed in the Council of Common Interests before it is made into law.
Political parties have yet to pass legislation on the delimitation of constituencies, deemed a constitutional necessity by the Election Commission of Pakistan, with regards to the holding of general elections next year.
Related News:
Imran Disrespects Institutions: Khursheed Shah

Khursheed Shah Accuses NAB of ‘Double Standards’

column2: Imran Challenges Election Reforms Act at SC
column5:
Islamabad (November 6, 2017): Chairman Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf Imran Khan has challenged Election Reforms Act 2017 at the Supreme Court.
The petition filed under Articles 183 and 184 of the constitution argues that after being declared ineligible as Member of National Assembly (MNA) Nawaz Sharif could not hold any post of his party.
In the Panama case the apex Supreme Court had declared Nawaz Sharif disqualified as MNA and he had to vacate the position as president of his party.
Specific amendments aimed at reinstalling Nawaz as party president were made in the Election Act. Arguing that these amendments are not only in violation of Articles 175 and 204 of the constitution but also in violation of Political Parties Orders 2002 Imran pleads the court to declare them null and void.
Related News:
Imran Labels Nawaz, Zardari as ‘GodFather of Corruption’

column2: PML-N To Win 2018 Election With Majority: Ameer Muqam
column5:
Murdan (November 05, 2017): Leader Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Ameer Muqam on Sunday said that PML-N will win 2018 election with thumping majority and Imran’s desire to become PM not to fulfill.
While addressing a public gathering in Murdan, he said that PML-N is a big political party in the country and it would come again in the next general election.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

He alleged that PTI leadership can not fool nation with lies anymore. Government working day and night to serve the masses.
Ameer Muqam said that elections will be held on time.
On October 27: Ameer Muqam congratulated leadership of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) for conducting rigging in the NA-4 by-election.
Ameer Muqam said that he upset to see the unexpected surge of votes for the PTI candidates in the constituency.
Related News:
Ameer Muqam Alleges PTI for Worst Rigging in NA-4 by-polls

Our Life And Death For Nawaz Sharif: Ameer Muqam

column2: PTI Reiterates Demand for Early Elections
column5:
Lahore (November 5, 2017): Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has once again demanded early elections. Party Spokesman Fawad Chaudhary said that PTI want early elections and we are ready to dissolve the Khyber Pakhtwankhwa (KPK) Assembly.
Calling for reviewing the electoral constituency bill, he said that these bills came under discussion at the Council of Common Interests but PTI will not accept election delayed on the pretext of the bill.
Fawad said that PTI have consensus over dissolving National and provincial assemblies. If all the parties agreed, PTI will also ready dissolve KPK assembly. Elections is the spirit of democracy and PTI would not accept delaying elections, he added.
Related News:
PTI to Show Political Mussle in Ubaro Today

PTI All Set to Demonstrate Street Power in Khanewal Today

column2: FATA Reforms: Sherpao Calls Delay Unreasonable
column5:
Charsadda (November 5, 2017); Rejecting population census in FATA, the chief of Qaumi Watan Party (QWP) and Member National Assembly Aftab Ahmad Khan Sherpao has called delay in FATA reforms unreasonable.
While talking to a delegation of FATA youth which called on him at his residence further said that establishment is not an obstacle to FATA reforms.
Reforms are being delayed because Nawaz Sharif does not want to lose the support of Mahmood Khan Acchakzai and JUI chief Maulana Fazlul Rahman.
Where in the constitution is it written that the future of FATA should be resolved through referendum, he asked claiming that the people of FATA too support amalgamation in Khyber Pakhtwankhwa province. The future of FATA should not be sacrificed to politics, he added.
Sherpao said that the failure to resolve electoral constituencies issue could delay the general elections next year. The cost of the delay would be borne by all, he warned.
Related News:
MQM, QWP Among 345 Parties Failed to Submit Assets Details

QWP Part Ways With PTI in KPK

column2: All Set For MQM-P Show in Karachi Today
column5:
Karachi (November 5, 2017): MQM is all set to flex its political muscles to show its might at the public rally here today.
The stage has been set and the chairs are arranged for MQMP’s public rally which be held at Liaquatabad flyover for which the over-pass has been closed for traffic.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video.

The workers, supporters, and sympathizers of the party thronged the venue throughout last night working hard to finalize the preparations for party’s mega show toady.
Party leaders visited the venue last night to review the preparations themselves and to boost the morale of workers, supporters, and sympathizers.Chief of MQMP Dr. Farooq Sattar has gone on record to call today’s public rally will be the declaration of next general elections next year in advance today. He also claimed that the politics of the parties that shed crocodile tears over the sufferings of the people is about to end.
Referring to recent population census Farooq Sattar said that since all the political parties have the same concerns and stand over it they should get united over this single point forgetting any and all the differences if any.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video.

It may be mentioned here that MQMP had earlier announced to hold the public rally at Quaid’s mausoleum. But changed the venue to Liaquatabad fly-over because it was not granted the permission to hold the rally there. It may also be mentioned here that today’s public rally is aimed at protesting the population census results with particular reference to Karachi and other cities of Sindh saying that the census counts do not reflect the actual numbers.
On the other hand, the workers of Quami Awami Tehreek (QAT) have also started gathering at Quaid’s mausoleum to participate in ‘Love Sindh’ march today.
Head of QAT Ayaz Lateef Palejo.will lead the march, which will culminate at Zaibun Nisa Street located in downtown district of the city- Saddar.
The “Love Sindh” march called by QAT is staged as a protest against corruption, terrorism, militancy, destruction of agriculture, issuance of national identity cards to Bengalis, Biharis, Burmese, and Afghan nationals as well as against erroneous population census.Saying that democracy and corruption could not run side-by-side Palejo expressed concerns over targeting of judiciary, NAB, and other national institutions for protecting corruption and for political interests.
If Nawaz Sharif and Asif Zardari are clean they should present themselves before NAB and courts, he added.
On the other hand, MQM- P also ready to flex its political muscles to show its might at the public rally here today.
Related News:
MQM-P To Hold Rally in Karachi At Any Cost: Farooq Sattar

MQM-P Postpones Meeting Due to Absence of Leaders, Workers

column2: PTI All Set to Challenge By-poll Results of NA-120
column5:
Lahore (November 04, 2017): Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has resolved to challenge the by-poll results of NA-120 in the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP).
According to the details, PTI’s candidate in NA-120, Dr Yasmin Rashid has prepared an application, in which he pleaded that by-poll results of the constituency should be declared null and void due to electoral irregularities that took place during the electioneering and on the polling day.Sources said that she will raise the issue of 29000 votes in her application. According to the sources, Yasmin Rashid has cited in her application that votes of overseas Pakistanis and departed souls were also casted in the by-election in the constituency NA-120. While some votes were registered more than one block code.
PTI will also plead the ECP to declared the by-poll results of NA-120 null and void as the state machinery was used to threaten their activists and to stop their mass motivation campaign in the constituency, said the sources.Earlier, Dr Yasmin Rashid had said that her party would not accept the results of the NA-120 by-election until the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) addressed its reservations over the validity of over 29,000 votes.
It is pertinent to mention here that the election Commission of Pakistan has issued the notification of Begum Kalsoom Nawaz success in NA-120 by -poll, which was held on September 17 and Kalsoom Nawaz defeated his rival candidate Yasmeen Rashid with more than 14000 lead.
Related News:
ECP Issues Notification of Kalsoom Nawaz Success from 120

N League wins decisive battle of NA-120 by-election

column2: Allah will Not Forgive Wajid Zia for Dubbing Me Liar: Safder
column5:
Islamabad (November 03, 2017):  MNA Captain (Retd) Safder has said that God will not forgive head of the Panama JIT Wajid Zia for dubbing him as liar, saying that he was custodian of a shire and Allah will hear to his pleas soon.
Talking to media after attending the hearing of NAB cases at accountability court Safdar said that Nawaz Sharif put the country on the path of progress and it was evident PML-N would win 2018 elections.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

He added that CPEC had become pat of Pakistan’s destiny, but attempts were being made to stop this project too.
However, he added, the project cannot be stopped now.Harshly criticizing the head of Panama JIT Wajid Zia, Safder said that he had termed him a liar in his report for which God will not forgive him.
He added that he was custodian of a Shrine and All will also hear to him.
Related News:
I am Being Punished for Eradicating Terrorism, Power Crisis: Nawaz

column2: Maryam Assumes Command for Election Campaign 2018
column5:
Lahore (November 02, 2017):  Maryam Nawaz, the daughter of former  Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has assumed the command for election campaign 2018 and resolved to kick off the drive from Southern Punjab.
While chairing an important meeting of PML-N at Jati Umra, the residence of Sharifs, Maryam directed the office-bearers to bring round the annoyed activists. After a successful election drive in NA-120, she decided to take the command of election 2018. The meeting reviewed the preparations and strategy for the next year’s general elections.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

According to the party sources, Maryam advised for effective campaigning in the 2018 elections. They also said she would visit all the divisions and districts of Punjab, starting from southern Punjab.
Related News:
PML-N To Win 2018 Elections: Maryam Nawaz Claims

Maryam, Safdar To Leave for Pakistan Today

column2: All Parties Agreed Upon Draft Delimitation Bill: Speaker
column5:
Islamabad (November 01, 2017): Speaker National Assembly Sardar Ayaz Sadiq on Wednesday said that parliamentary parties’ leaders had given then consent to the draft bill regarding delimitation of constituencies in the light of the fresh population census.
Talking to media after presiding over the meeting of parliamentary parties in NA here to discuss the bill and related issues,  Sadiq said that all parties were unanimous and would support the Bill in NA.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

In response to a question, Sadiq said a total of 780,000 people will be represented by MNA in NA seat after the readjustment.He said the Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) will now begin the process of delimitation according to the provisional results of the population census for General Elections 2018.
The meeting was attended by leaders of major political parties, including Khursheed Shah of Pakistan People’s Party and Shah Mehmood Qureshi of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf, Mahmood Khan Achakzai, Sabizada Tariqullah Khan, and others.During yesterday meeting, the parliamentary parties leaders had decided that the strength of 272 members of the National Assembly will be retained, but the its provincial makeup against the backdrop of the newly-conducted census would be changed.
It was decided that the number of seats for Punjab will decrease by nine, which will add to the strength of Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, while an additional seat would be allocated to Islamabad.
The re-composition of the National Assembly was necessary after the census 2017.
“The number of seats will remain the same. There will be a change in the allocation of seats for the provinces,” Sadiq had told reporters after the meeting.Punjab will cede nine seats, including seven general and two reserved for women. Of the nine seats, four general seats and one reserved for women will go to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa while Balochistan will see an increase of two general seats and one for women.
There will be one additional seat for the Islamabad Capital Territory while Sindh and the Federally-Administered Tribal Areas (Fata) will see no change to their strength. Currently, the ICT has two seats which would now become three.Speaking to the media, the speaker elaborated that the parliamentary leaders had decided in principle to retain the seats of the National Assembly. He said the data for delimitation at tehsil level would be received on Wednesday (today) and another meeting would be held.
“All agree that the seats should not be increased,” the speaker said. “The number of seats for Punjab will decrease, K-P and Balochistan will see an increase, and an additional seat would be allocated to Islamabad,” he added.
Related News:
NA Seats Not to Be Increased Thru New Delimitation: Speaker

column2: Pir Kaleem Khursheed of Asma Group Wins SCBA Election
column5:
Lahore (October 31, 2017): Nominee of Asma Jahangir’s Independent group Peer Syed Muhammad Kaleem Ahmed Khursheed has won Supreme Court Bar Association’s elections on Tuesday.
The group’s candidate Pir Kaleem Khursheed bagged 1,145 votes, defeating Hafiz Abdur Rehman of Hamid Khan’s Professional Group who could secure only 1,062 votes.
Safdar Hussain Tarar achieved 1,098 votes against 638 votes of Professional Group’s Mian Muhammad Aslam.
A very close contest was observed between the presidential candidates as the winning candidate marked victory with a narrow margin of only 83 votes.
After his winning, Pir Kaleem Khursheed thanked the lawyers for voting him and said that he will not associate Bar with any political party.He said that all the political parties voted for me and I will work for Lawyers and Nation as well. We need to follow the golden principles of Quaid e Azam to make Pakistan a stronger state.
Earlier,  the polling started at 9:00 am continued till 5:00 pm without any interval. Polling was held in Multan, Bahawalpur, and Abbottabad, where polling stations have been established.
A close competition was expected between the candidates of Asma Jahangir and Hamid Khan groups for the seat of president.
Syed Muhammad Kaleem Ahmed Khursheed was the nominee of Jahangir’s Independent group, while Hafiz Abdul Rehman Ansari enjoyed the support of Hamid Khan-led Professional group.
As many as 44 candidates are contesting the election for 22 seats of the association.A total of 2,989 voters can cast their votes, and most of the registered voters are based in Lahore.
Chairman Election Board Afrasiyab Khan is monitoring the election process.
Last year, Rashid Rizvi, of the Hamid Khan-led group, was elected the SCBA president.
Related News:
Polling for SCBA Elections Ends, Vote Counting Starts

column2: PTI To Oppose Legislation Aimed at Delaying Elections: Imran
column5:
Islamabad (October 31, 2017): The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) leader Imran Khan on Tuesday said that his party will oppose any legislation that aims at delaying the general elections.
Imran took to Twitter to express his opinion, which comes a day after he alleged that the Pakistan Muslim League – Nawaz’s (PML-N) president and former prime minister Nawaz Sharif seemed to be desperate for another National Reconciliation Ordinance (NRO)-like deal.
Given the complete paralysis in governance, PTI will oppose any legislation aimed at delaying General Elections.
— Imran Khan (@ImranKhanPTI) October 31, 2017
“He is desperate for NRO to avoid conviction on money laundering and save his Rs300 billion stashed abroad from being frozen,” Imran had tweeted.
Earlier, ECP officials said that next general elections to be held in July and current government’s tenure will end on June 5.
Officials said that to ensure transparency in the elections, watermark papers will be used and ECP will not print more ballot papers.Yesterday, a high-level PML-N huddle in London on Monday decided that Nawaz would continue as the head of the PML-N but also tone down his tirade against state institutions on the basis of his “unfair trial”.
The former prime minister had said that he will return to Pakistan to attend the corruption trial against him on Friday.
Last week, the accountability court hearing corruption references against the Sharif family issued bailable warrants for the former premier in the three references against him as he has lately been a no-show in the proceedings.The references against the Sharif family pertain to the Azizia Steel Mills and Hill Metals Establishment, their London properties and over dozen offshore companies owned by the family.
The hearing was then adjourned until November 3, with the last chance for the former premier to ensure his presence in court.
Related News:
Maryam’s Front-foot Politics Cause of Rift in PML-N: Aitzaz

Next General Elections Will Be Held in 2018: ECP

column2: Next General Elections Will Be Held in 2018: ECP
column5:
Islamabad (October 31, 2017): The general election will be conducted in July 2018 as the incumbent government will complete its tenure on June 5, 2018.
In a workshop held by the ECP, officials said that next general elections to be conducted in July and current government’s tenure will end on June 5.
Officials said that to ensure transparency in the elections, watermark papers will be used and ECP will not print more ballot papers.
During the workshop, officials decided that independent Returning Officers will also be appointed for the polling.While highlighting the issues pertaining to fee structure for candidates, ECP revised nomination papers’s fee structure. National Assembly candidates will now have to pay Rs30,000 whereas legislators contesting for Senate and provincial assemblies will have to pay RS20,000.
Officials said in December, a door-to-door verification of voters will take place, whereas the electoral rolls will display the voters’ lists in January 2018.
In January, the objections to the lists will be fixed and from March to April the new lists will be published.Over 100 million voters will cast votes and ECP prepared code of conduct for polling stations and security issues. It is also decided that maximum 1200 voters will be in a polling station.
ECP also  set a limit for candidate to spend for election campaigning. As per details, upper house candidates will be allowed to spend Rs4 million, provincial assemblies’ candidates will be allowed to spend Rs2 million and Senate candidates will be allowed to spend Rs1.5 million.
Related News:
ECP Hears Imran ‘s Reference Against Ex-PTI Minister Ziaullah Afridi

PTI Moves ECP for Scrutiny of Other Parties Accounts

column2: Polling for SCBA Annual Elections Starts
column5:
Lahore (October 31, 2017): Polling for the annual elections of Supreme Court Bar Association (SCBA) started at different cities of the country including Lahore.
A total of 29,992 members of the country’s top bar are exercising their right to vote in various cities of the country including including Lahore, Karachi, Islamabad, Quetta, Sukkur, Haiderabad, Multan, Bahawalpur and Abottabad.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

Polling started at 8: 30am which will continue until 5:00pm. The legal fraternity’s top groups –Professional Group of Hamid Khan and Independent Group of Asma Jahangir – have fielded their candidates against all slots.  Contrary to the previous year, the president would be elected from Punjab this time.
The Hamid Khan’s group has nominated Abdur Rehman Ansari and Asma’s group fielded Pir Kaleem Khursheed as candidate for the top slot of president.For of secretary, Safdar Hussain Tarar is representing Independent Group while Professional Group has fielded Mian Muhammad Aslam.  The candidates and their supporters have been running their campaigns to win maximum votes.
The traditional hustle and bustle is on its peak among the senior members. Last year, Hamid Khan’s Group won the top slots of bar.
Related News:
SCBA Elections: Polling underway

http://abbtakk.tv/en/scba-elections-asma-jehangir-group-wins3110204/

column2: Election as PMLN Pres: IHC Directs Nawaz to Submit Reply
column5:
Islamabad (October 30, 2017): Islamabad High Court (IHC) has directed disqualified prime minister Nawaz Sharif to submit reply by November 14 in the petition challenging his election as president of PMLN.
The IHC  issued a written order for fixing the date for the hearing of the petition challenging Nawaz’s election as party president. On the order of the court the Registrar Office of the IHC has sent a notice to the ousted prime minister.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video.

Notices have also been issued to federal Secretary Law, Secretary Establishment Division, Chief Election Commissioner, and Secretary Election Commission Pakistan on the petition filed by Makhdoom Niaz Inqalabi and Abrar Raza. The petitioners challenge Sections 232 and 203 of the Election Act.

It may be mentioned here that  on the ninth of this month the court had issued notices to ousted prime minister Nawaz Sharif, Attorney General, Chief Election Commissioner, Secretary Election Commission, Secretary Establishment Division in the case challenging Nawaz being elected president of Pakistan Muslim League (N). The written order pertains to the notices that it issued then.
IHC will hear the case on November 14.


Petitioner Makhdoom Inqalabi advocate argues that Election Act 2017 passed by the National Assembly and the Senate recently that allows a disqualified person to head a political party is in violation with the basic structure of the constitution.
The petitioner further argues that various cases seeking Nawaz’s election as party president and cancellation of the registration of PMLN are under hearing at various courts pleads the court to stop Nawaz Sharif engage in political activities as the president of PMLN till these cases are disposed by the court.

He pleads that till the disposal of the pending application, implementation on section 203 and 232 of Election Act be stayed. The petitioner has also pleaded the court to declare the Election Act 2017 as ultra vires of the constitution.
It is to be mentioned here that the General Council of Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) had re-elected Nawaz Sharif as party chief by amending its constitution allowing a person ineligible or disqualified to be member of the parliament to head the party.
Related News:
Nawaz Sharif Elected PML-N President Unopposed

IHC Moved Against Nawaz’s Election as PML-N Chief

column2: Ameer Muqam Alleges PTI for Worst Rigging in NA-4 by-polls
column5:
Peshawar (October 27, 2017): Leader Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) Ameer Muqam on Friday congratulated leadership of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) for conducting rigging in the NA-4 by-election.
While addressing at a press conference in Peshawar, Ameer Muqam said that he upset to see the unexpected surge of votes for the PTI candidates in the constituency.

He said that I congratulate Imran Khan and Pervaiz Khattak for conducting worst poll rigging in the NA-4 by-election.
The PML-N leader said that five MPAs of the constituency were actively campaigning for the by-election. Developmental work after the announcement of election schedule comes under pre-poll rigging, he added.Yesterday, PTI defeated its opponents in the by-election on the key NA-4 seat.
According to the 250 polling stations results: PTI’s Aamir Ayub Leads with 43592 Votes, PML N’s Nasir Musazai is following him with 23603, while ANP’s Khushdil Khan is at number three with 23361 votes and PPP’s Asad Gulzar has secured 12409 votes.

AbbTakk News Acquires Unofficial Results of NA4 (Part 4)

column2: Padmavati’s Ghoomar Breaks All Records In Just Single Day
column5:
Mumbai(October 27, 2017): The first song of the classic movie ‘Padmavati’ is trending crazy, and has received a humongous 10 million views in just one day.
The music video is so stunning and engaging that the fans cannot take their eyes off. Seeing such response, we can already hear award announcements for this movie.

In the song Ghoomar, Deepika is wearing a stunning heavy Rajputi attire and donning Jadau jewelry.

It is said that She has almost done 66 twirls in the entire performance. The song was choreographed under the amazing Kruti Mahesh Midya and Ghoomar artist via Rajasthan, Jyothi D Tommaar, who made the dimple queen swirl so easily and naturally.

Kruti Mahesh Midya said, “She trained with us for three hours every day before the shoot commenced.” She explained how Deepika’s moves essentially focused on the twirling movement (ghoomna).

column2: Excess with Nawaz is Actually Excess with Ideology of Pak: Safder
column5:
Islamabad (October 26, 2017): MNA and son in law of former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif,  Captain (retd) Muhammad Safder on Thursday said that excess with Nawaz Sharif was actually excess with the Ideology of Pakistan and state of Pakistan.
Talking to media after appearing before the accountability court, Safder said that Nawaz Sharif was ousted from power for several times, imprisoned in Attock Jail and send on forced exile.
To a question he said that those who rendered sacrifices for the honor and dignity of the Holy Prophet were his heroes.When a journalist said he looked tired and exhausted today, Safder said that he had travelled long way to reach Islamabad for the hearing.
“I am a real captain while Imran is fake one so don’t compare me with him,” Safder remarked when a journalist pointed out that on one hand Imran is appearing before ECP today and on the other you were appearing before the accountability court.
After appearing before the court, Safder went to Golra Sharif Shrine and offered Fateha there.Earlier, talking to media State Minister for Interior Talal Chaudhry said  that the only way to deal with the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz chief is by working under the ambit of law and constitution.
He said that the tone of party leaders has become harsh due to the constant injustices they are facing.
“Nawaz has been indicted against the spirit of the Constitution,” he claimed.
The Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz representative said that there should be supremacy of law in the country.Chaudhry called Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf Chairman Imran Khan an absconder from the anti-terrorism court and Election Commission of Pakistan.
He said that they (PML-N) won’t let the vision of former president General (retd) Pervez Musharraf and his cronies be implemented in the country.
Related News
Maryam Nawaz Responds to ‘VIP Accountability’ Comments

Schedule Changed: Nawaz to Return on January 7 Now

column2: Presidential Election Again Set to Go in Kenya Today
column5:
Nairobi(October 26, 2017): Kenya’s controversial presidential election will go ahead again today.
Last month, the Supreme Court has annulled the August 8 election on basis of result procedure and ordered to hold re-election again.
However, opposition leader  Raila Odinga has boycotted the ballot election due to alleged failure of Election Commission for implementation of reforms.

Kenya’s SC Nullifies Presidential Election Result

Kenya:  Uhuru Kenyatta Wins Presidential Elections

column2: Polling Underway for Crucial NA-4 Peshawar By-election
column5:
Peshawar (October 26, 2017): Polling has started for the crucial by-election of NA-4 Peshawar constituency here.
Many observers consider the by-poll as a litmus test for the popularity of the Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) government in the province.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

The seat had fallen vacant after the death of dissident PTI MNA Gulzar Khan on Aug 28.
At some polling stations of the constituency, polling started with delay.
The by-election is considered as litmus test of the ruling PTI and its government over 4-year performance in the province.Strict security arrangements have been made by the administration for the by-elections. Deputy Commissioner Peshawar has banned brandishing and displaying of arms and rallies in the constituency by imposing Sec-144. Pilling riding and assembly of more than four people have also been banned.
Analysts said that the NA-4 Peshawar is for the Pakistan Tehreek-i-Insaf (PTI) what NA-120 Lahore was for the Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz (PML-N) in last month’s by-election.
Victory in the by-election would be a verdict on its four-year rule in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and losing the election would not only be demoralising but would also give a boost to its political foes, waiting eagerly to regain their lost territory.Not surprisingly, therefore, both parties have thrown their full political might and resources into the contest. Both have pumped massive federal and provincial funds into NA-4 for launching new projects, or to complete the ongoing ones before schedule. Gulzar’s son, Asad Gulzar, is also on the list but he is contesting election on PPP ticket, which he recently joined. PTI has fielded Arbab Amir, brother of Arbab Zahir who was elected on the seat on the ticket of Awami National Party. Amir had recently jumped ship from ANP.
From PML-N, Nasir Musazai will be contesting the by-poll. Musazai is backed by QWP and JUI-F that withdrew its candidate announcing support for PML-N.
ANP has fielded the former deputy speaker of KP Assembly, Khushdil Khan, while Jamaat-e-Islami has fielded Wasil Farooq Khan, whose candidate in last general election stood third.NA-4 comprises rural areas of Peshawar, including Hazar Khwani, Chamkani and Badhber. One side of the constituency connects to GT Road via Chamkani, while the other meets Pabbi, Nowshera. The area of Badbher connects the constituency with Khyber Agency, while the route of Mattani joins it to Darra Adam Khel in Frontier Region Kohat.The geographic location of the constituency and terrorism incidents that have taken place there in the past are the reason why all the polling stations there have been declared sensitive while 182 have been marked as ‘most sensitive’.The constituency is home to around 600,000 people who call it a hub of problems as gas and electricity load-shedding and lack of potable water and schools for girls have made their routine life difficult.
In the heart of the constituency is situated Sher Shah Suri Road where vehicles can be seen struggling their way through the rickety path around Phandu Chowk.As far as security arrangements are concerned, Pakistan Army personnel will be deployed inside and outside at all the polling stations of the NA-4, Peshawar-IV by-election. Around five thousand Police personnel will also be deployed to monitor law and order situation in the constituency.
According to an official of ECP, the constituency had total 397,904 registered voters, out of which 235,164 are men while 162,740 are women.He said that total 269 polling stations including 150 for men, 110 women and 10 combined polling station have been set up for by-election.
The registered voter strength in the constituency is 397, 952, among them 235,127 male and 162,825 females.  The Election Commission of Pakistan has established 269.Out of these stations, 39 polling stations will experience electronic voting system for the first time in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa.
All the major parties of the province have been running extensive campaigns to muster support ahead of the by-polls.NA-4 is the biggest constituency of Peshawar from where many influential political families draw their strength.
NA-4 was won by PTI candidate Gulzar Khan in 2013 with a total of 55,134 votes. Nasir Khan Mosazai (PML-N), Sabir Hussain Awan (Jamaat-e-Islami) and Arbab Ayub Jan (ANP) followed with 20,412, 16,493 and 15,796 votes, respectively.
The turnout in 2013 polls was recorded at 40.34 percent as 138,555 votes were polled out of which 3,707 were rejected.
The seat fell vacant after PTI’s then MNA Gulzar Khan passed away on August 28 this year. In the 2013 polls, the PTI candidate had secured 55,134 votes,  while Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz’s (PML-N) Nasir Musazi had obtained 20,412 votes. Moreover, Jamaat-e-Islami’s (JI) Sabir Awan had garnered 16,493 votes while Awami National Party’s (ANP) candidate Arbab Ayub Jan had received 15,795 votes. While Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-F (JUI-F) candidate, Arbab Kamal, had secured 12,519 votes followed by the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) candidate, Misbahud¬din, who got over 12,000 votes in the election.
Related News:
NA 4 By-election: All Set For Big Contest Today

column2: Peshawar NA-4 By-Election: A look at Main Candidates
column5:
Web Desk (October 26, 2017): All is set for the polling today in National Assembly constituency of NA-4 Peshawar. A fierce fight is expected to be waged by candidates for the seat left vacant after the death of PTI MNA Gulzar Khan.
Though 15 candidates are contesting the by-election a fierce fight is expected between between PTI candidate Arbab Omer, PMLN’s Nasir Khan Moosazai, Awami national Party’s Khushdul Khan, and Peoples Party’s Asad Gulzar.
The following are the particulars of some of the major candidates:
PTI’s candidate Arbab Amir Ayub PTI hails from  political party.
یونین کونسل ادیزئی جلسہ۔ عوام کی بھرپور تعداد میں شرکت۔اہلیان ادیزئی کا تحریک انصاف کی پالیسیوں، طرز حکومت اور منشور پر اعتماد۔#NA4 pic.twitter.com/vRHNDSXMZM
— Arbab Amir Ayub (@ArbabAmirPTI) September 28, 2017
His family has rendered immense sacrifices in independence struggle of Pakistan. Arbab joined PTI being influenced by Imran’s vision for eradicating corruption. He feels that no political party carried out more development works in NA-4 than the PTI during its four-year tenure. Arbab says that success in NA-4 is PTI’s destiny. He vows that after winning the election he will fulfill all the promises he made to the people of NA-4.
PMLN’s Nasir Khan Moosazai has already made a name in politics.
InshaAllah PMLN will continue it’s winning streak in elections by conquering NA4 when ppl vote for Nawaz Sharif.#NA4BheeSherKa pic.twitter.com/AjyY27Dhwa
— PML(N) (@pmln_org) October 25, 2017
He is influenced by his leader Nawaz Sharif. Born in a business family on September 1, 1975, Nasir completed MBA and got Law degree and started his political journey from PMLN’s platform. He joined politics after getting frustrated over development works in his electoral constituency and he is hopeful to get success in politics. He has accused PTI using government resources to win the election but simultaneously optimistic that the voters would deliver electoral defeat to PTI. Known for keeping promises Nasir is regarded as a close lieutenant of Nawaz Sharif. He is certain that PMLN will win the NA-4 by-election with big majority.
ANP’s Khushdil Khan is a former deputy of KPK Assembly.
#Vote4ANP pic.twitter.com/NCdl51fxkV
— Zarmeena Khan (@ZarmeenaKhanANP) October 25, 2017
He is not only a strong candidate but enjoys a distinct political stature in the constituency. Hailing from an educated family, Khushdil holds a Law degree is moved by the vision of his party leaders. He entered in politics from the platform of ANP and after winning the 2008 general elections on ANP ticket, he became the deputy speaker of KPK Assembly. Known for resolving issues and development projects in the constituency is as popular in politics as a lawyer. The easy-going and mild-talking Khushdil is considered a close colleague of party chief Asfandaryar Wali khan.
Though a newcomer in politics PPP’s Asad Gulzar Khan cares immensely for the people of the constituency.
یو سی موسیٰ زئی میں کارنر میٹنگ اسد گلزار خان اور خواجہ محمد ہوتی کی شرکت #NA4 #PPP #asadgulzarkhan #gulzarkhanipakarda pic.twitter.com/NI7OpDDahu
— Asad Gulzar Khan (@AsadGulzarKhan1) October 23, 2017
He is a son of former late PTI MNA Gulzar Khan who says that his late father had many differences with the PTI over principles while he himself never remained a part of PTI. Known as a courageous and man of principles Asad says that though many political parties had approached him after the death of his father co-chairman PPP Asif Ali Zardari and former prime minister Yusuf Raza Gilani had approached him in person which made him start his political career from PPP’s platform. Asad says that after winning the by-election with big majority PPP will serve the people of constituency in the best way possible.
Related News:
Polling Underway for Crucial NA-4 Peshawar By-election

Security Arrangements Finalized for NA-4 By-Election

column2: Govt Committed For Equal Development of All Areas: PM
column5:
Gilgit(October 25, 2017): Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi has said that federal government will continue to extend cooperation for equal development of all the areas in the country.
Addressing the meeting of Gilgit Baltistan council in Skardu on Wednesday, he said Gilgit Baltistan can greatly benefit from China-Pakistan Economic Corridor (CPEC) project.
He said that it was the first government which practically started work on Diamer Basha Dam. Development of the country is our priority, he added.Shahid Khaqan Abbasi said it was a matter of great satisfaction that the democratic process was moving forward in Gilgit Baltistan.
Meanwhile, the meeting of Gilgit Baltistan council is in progress which will approve budget for the year 2017-18.Chief Minister GB Hafiz Hafeezur Rehman, Governor Gilgit-Baltistan Ghazanfer Ali Khan, Federal Minister for Kashmir and GB Affairs Birjees Tahir and members of GB Council attended the meeting.
Related News:

column2: NA-4 by-polls: Election Campaigns Concluded
column5:
Peshawar (October 25, 2017): All the election campaigns, carried out by different political parties and independent candidates in NA-4 Peshawar constituency, concluded on Tuesday midnight.
Polling will be held in the constituency on October 26. In light of the upcoming by-election, the constituency’s roads and intersections are adorned with posters, panaflex banners and campaign material.
According to a statement by the Peshawar deputy commissioner on Monday, the polling day, Oct 26, will be a holiday for the convenience of the voters.
The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP), for the first time in the country, will be using electronic voting machines (EVMs) during the by-election. As many as 269 polling stations would be established for the by-poll. Of them, the EVMs would be used in over 100 polling booths of 35 polling stations in both urban and rural areas of the constituency.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

Around 47,255 voters are expected to cast their votes through the EVMs along with the manual voting process. There are a total of 397,904 registered voters in the constituency, of which 235,164 are male and 162,740 female.The seat fell vacant after PTI’s then MNA Gulzar Khan passed away on August 28 this year. In the 2013 polls, the PTI candidate had secured 55,134 votes while Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz’s (PML-N) Nasir Musazi had obtained 20,412 votes. Moreover, Jamaat-e-Islami’s (JI) Sabir Awan had garnered 16,493 votes while Awami National Party’s (ANP) candidate Arbab Ayub Jan had received 15,795 votes. While Jamiat Ulema-e-Islam-F (JUI-F) candidate, Arbab Kamal, had secured 12,519 votes followed by the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) candidate, Misbahud¬din, who got over 12,000 votes in the election.
In total, 15 candidates are vying for the MNA slot, with six from political parties and nine independents. The PTI is fielding Arbab Amir Ayub; the PPP Asad Gulzar, late incumbent Gulzar Khan’s son; the ANP Khushdil Khan, former deputy speaker of the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Assembly and the JI, Wisal Farooq.
At present, the PML-N has again given the ticket to last time’s runner-up, Musazai, who is being supported by the JUI-F and the Qaumi Watan Party.

PTI leader Shafqat Mahmood also spoke to media earlier.

Ayesha Gulalai to remain MNA after ECP dismisses Imran Khan’s reference.
Earlier, the ECP dismissed the disqualification reference filed against MNA Ayesha Gulalai, following which she will remain a member of the National Assembly from the PTI.

column2: Senate Passes The Elections Amendment Bill, 2017
column5:
Islamabad (October 23, 2017): The Senate on Monday approved an amendment to clause 203 of the Elections Bill 2017, barring a disqualified person from heading a political party.
During the Senate session, opposition parties tabled amendments to the much-debated clause of the previously approved Elections Bill 2017.
Clause 203 of the Elections Bill 2017 pertains to membership of political parties, which allows every citizen to have the right to form or be a member or office-bearer of a political party, despite the person being out of the service of Pakistan.
However, the amendment tabled in the Senate suggests that a person who is not eligible to become a member of the Parliament cannot head a political party.
The amended bill was opposed by the government with Federal Minister of Law Zahid Hamid expressing reservations.However, it was passed with a clear majority of 49, including leaders from the Federally Administered Tribal Areas, voting in favour of the amendment.
Earlier in the Senate, on October 11, a resolution was passed on the same matter.
The resolution, presented by Leader of the Opposition in the Senate Aitzaz Ahsan, stated that a person who is not eligible to become a member of the Parliament or has been disqualified cannot lead any political party.
The step was taken against the approval given to ousted prime minister Nawaz Sharif to head the ruling party, Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz, after amendments were made to the Elections Bill, 2017.
PML-N Senator Mushahidullah Khan reacted to development on the Elections Bill, 2017, saying such a resolution, which called for distancing a leader from its people, meant nothing to them.He added passing of the amended bill meant “Bhuttoism has lost” while “Musharraf and Ayubism won”.
However, the senator said, people of Pakistan still consider Nawaz Sharif their leader.
The bill moved by Taj Haider and others provides to amend the Election Act 2017.
The Anti-Terrorism (Amendment) Bill, 2017,” the Constitution (Amendment) Bill, 2017,” the Federal Universities (Amendment) Bill, 2017,” the National Commission on the Status of Women (Amendment) Bill, 2017, the Prevention and Management of Conflict of Interest Bill, 2017″ were also introduced in the house today.
The Chair referred the bills to the concerned committees of the House.
Related News:
Senate Unanimously Passed Amended Election Bill 2017

NA Passes Bill to Restore Khatm-e-Nabuwwat Oath

column2: Pirzada Reiterates Call for Shahbaz to Take Over PML-N
column5:
Islamabad (October 23, 2017) : Federal Minister for Inter-Provincial Coordination Riaz Hussain Pirzada has reiterated his call for Punjab Chief Minister Shehbaz Sharif to take over Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz in the prevailing circumstances.
Talking to media, the minister said that he stuck to his stance that Shahbaz should take over the party which he said is in the best interest of the party and country.
“Shehbaz Sharif is an obedient brother and that’s why he said that he should take over the party and I still adhere to my statements,” said Pirzada.
He said that there is no double meaning or conspiracy behind his words. Regarding criticism of his statement, he said that he did not call upon a Brigadier Shahbaz Sharif to take over or 111 brigade to take over PML-N rather an obedient brother of Nawaz Sharif to take charge of party.
“We don’t object to Nawaz’s leadership but we are concerned how the party will go into the next elections,” said Pirzada.
Earlier in an apparent sign of a revolt, Pirzada suggested that the Punjab Chief Minister Shehbaz would be the best choice to lead the party.
He said that there will be a vacuum in the party if Shehbaz Sharif was not made the president. Shehbaz Sharif’s advice to the party should be accepted, as he was dealing with the public opinion in a better way, he added.

column2: Shinzo Abe Secures Victory in Japan Snap Election
column5:
Tokyo (October 22, 2017): Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe swept to a comfortable victory in a snap election on Sunday, handing him a mandate to harden his already hawkish stance on North Korea and re-energise the world’s number-three economy.
Abe’s conservative coalition was on track to win 311 seats in the 465-seat parliament, according to a projection published by private broadcaster TBS, putting the nationalist blue blood on course to become Japan’s longest-serving leader.
The comfortable election win is likely to stiffen Abe’s resolve to tackle North Korea’s nuclear menace, as the key US regional ally seeks to exert maximum pressure on the regime in Pyongyang after it fired two missiles over Japan in the space of a month.

Abe was heading for a “landslide win,” the Yomiuri daily said on its website.
Millions of Japanese braved torrential rain and driving winds to vote, as a typhoon bears down on the country with many heeding warnings to cast their ballots early.
Abe’s Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) benefitted from a weak and splintered opposition, with the two main parties facing him created only a matter of weeks ago.
Support for the Party of Hope founded by popular Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike fizzled after an initial blaze of publicity and was on track to win around 50 seats, the TBS projection suggested.
Speaking from Paris where she was attending an event in her capacity as leader of the world’s biggest city, a sullen-faced Koike told public broadcaster NHK she feared a “very severe result”.
The new centre-left Constitutional Democratic Party fared slightly better than expected but was still far behind Abe.
It was unclear in the immediate aftermath of the vote whether Abe’s coalition would retain its two-thirds “supermajority.”
Such a “supermajority” would allow Abe to propose changes to Japan’s US-imposed constitution that forces it to “renounce” war and effectively limits its military to a self-defence role.
The short 12-day campaign was dominated by the economy and the global crisis over North Korea, which has threatened to “sink” Japan into the sea.
Nationalist Abe stuck to a hardline stance throughout, stressing that Japan “would not waver” in the face of an increasingly belligerent regime in Pyongyang.
Despite the sabre-rattling from North Korea, many voters said reviving the once-mighty Japanese economy was the top priority, with Abe’s trademark “Abenomics” policy failing to trickle down to the general public.

The three-pronged combination of ultra-loose monetary policy, huge government spending and structural reform has catapulted the stock market to a 21-year high but failed to stoke inflation and growth has remained sluggish.
Although voters turned out in their millions to back Abe, support for the 63-year-old is lukewarm and surveys showed his decision to call a snap election a year earlier than expected was unpopular.
Koike briefly promised to shake up Japan’s sleepy political scene with her new party but she declined to run herself for a seat, sparking confusion over who would be prime minister if she won.
In the end, the 65-year-old former TV presenter was not even in Japan on election day.
The campaign was marked by a near-constant drizzle in large parts of the country and rallies frequently took place under shelter and a sea of umbrellas.
But this did not dampen the enthusiasm of hundreds of doughty, sash-wearing parliamentary hopefuls, who have driven around in minibuses pleading for votes via loudspeaker and bowing deeply to every potential voter.

column2: PTI To Hold A Rally in Sehwan Today
column5:
Dadu (October 22, 2017): The Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) is set to hold a rally in Sehwan, Sindh today.
According to details, PTI will hold a public gathering in Sehwan Sharif, a city located in PPP-governed province Sindh, and PPP will display political power in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa’s provincial capital Peshawar where PTI is in command.
Former Sindh chief minister and PTI’s local leader, Liaquat Ali Jatoi, said the organisers have placed 40,000 chairs at Lal Bahadur Ground for the public gathering whereas 80,000 will be able to attend the rally while standing.
Moreover, around 1,000 police personnel have been deployed to secure the event, which will be addressed by PTI Chairman Imran Khan.
On the other hand, PPP is ready to demonstrate its political show in Mashu Gagar, an area of NA-4 constituency. The stage is made and chairs have been set at the venue. PPP Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari will address the workers to boost their spirits.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video


In a video message on Saturday, Imran said that Sindh, in comparison to the other provinces, is in dire need of reforms.
He said that people of Sindh province needed change more as compared to anyone else.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video

“People of Sindh have been looted the most and that is the reason that the province needs a fresh start,” Imran said.
He added that farmers don’t have access to water as feudal lords continue to rule the province.
“I will soon hold a political rally in Sindh,” he said, adding that a proper plan to overhaul the province’s infrastructure and laws needs to be introduced.
Inviting deprived people of Sindh for Sehwan public gathering, Imran Khan said he would give his future plan there to pull Sindh out of such major crises and develop this province.
Chairman PTI Imran Khan Exclusive Message for PTI Jalsa Sehwan on 22 October 2017#PTI pic.twitter.com/o5H7HOVxaL
— PTI (@PTIofficial) October 21, 2017
The PTI chief’s statement comes at a time when political parties are geared up to gain support for the upcoming elections in 2018.
The Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) — Sindh’s ruling party — has a strong voter base in the province. The tug of war between PTI and the PPP to secure the most votes from the province continues with PPP leaders lashing out at Imran and vice versa.Addressing a rally in Hyderabad on Wednesday, PPP Chairman Bilawal Bhutto Zardari had criticised Imran for using corruption as a ‘mere slogan.’
“There are some politicians who have not yet come out of the cricket ground.”
The Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) — Sindh’s ruling party — has a strong voter base in the province.
PPP’s Murad Ali Shah, the present chief minister of Sindh, also hails from Sehwan.

column2: All Terrorists Safe Hideouts Housed in Afghanistan: FO
column5:
Islamabad (October 19, 2017): Saying that Pakistan is taking action against terrorists without any distinction between them Foreign Office spokesman Nafees Zakaria added that all the safe hideouts of terrorists are housed in Afghanistan.
Addressing the weekly press briefing here the FO spokesman said that American-Canadian couple and recovered recently by the Pak army was also kidnapped from Afghan territory.
Pakistan has raised the issue pertaining to abduction of a Pakistani national within the Afghan territory with the Afghan government, while the leadership of the US and Pakistan have decided to keep mutual contacts continue.Pak army safely recovered the US-Canadian couple along with its children despite kidnappers continuously changing places and the couple’s recovery was the result of intelligence cooperation between Pakistan and the US.
Expressing sorrow at the killings of four more Kashmiris and injuring another 60 unarmed Kashmiris by pellet guns by Indian forces in Occupied Kashmir Nafees Zakaria said that Pakistan condemns house of Hurriet leaders including Mir Waiz in Indian-held Kashmir.The discovery of unmarked graves in 2009 and killing Kashmiris in fake encounters are open proofs of Indian barbarism.
Condemning the attack in Maywand district of southern Afghan province of Kandahar that killed 43 Afghan soldiers the FO spokesman said Pakistan has eradicated terrorism from its soil by taking action against all terrorist outfits without any distinction.
The FO spokesman informed that during the 8th phase of the meeting with European Union this month the two sides agreed to continue cooperation over a number of issues including trade. Saying that China-Pakistan Economic Corridor project would help better communication between the cities in the region Nafees Zakaria said that the CPEC project enjoys the support of around 100 countries.Calling One Belt One Road an extremely positive Chinese project the FO spokesman refraining from commenting on the killings of OMER Khalid Khurasani and Omer Mansoor in the drone attacks said that he has watched the news of the death of the mastermind of APS and Charsadda University attacks.
Terming winning election for member of UN Human Rights Council a big success for Pakistan Nafees Zakaria said that Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi has left for Turkey earlier today to attend the D-8 Conference Foreign Minister Khawaja Asif has already reached Turkey.

column2: Imran Challenges ECP’s Non-Bailable Arrest Warrant in IHC
column5:
Islamabad (October 18, 2017): Chairman Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Imran Khan has challenged the non-bailable arrest warrnts issued against him by Election Commission Pakistan (ECP) at the Islamabad High Court (IHC).
Filed by Imran’s counsel Babar Awan the petition seeking declaring the warrants, which it calls illegal, null and void accuses ECP surpassing its authority.
Click Play Button To Watch This Video.

The petition also argues that the issuance of Imran’s non-bailable arrest warrant violates basic rights and an attempt by his opponents and critics to make the butt of their revenge.
The petition names Chief Election Commissioner and party-dissident petitioner Akbar S. Babar seeking Imran’s disqualification at the ECP as respondents.It may be mentioned here that ECP had issued the said warrant against Imran in the case pertaining to contempt of court. The ECP had ordered arresting Imran and producing him before it on October 26.
The ECP had decided to issue the warrant by 3-2 votes with members OF Election Commission Punjab and Sindh opposing it while Chief Election Commissioner, member Khyber Pakhtwankhwa and member Balochistan favoring it.Earlier the ECP had issued Imran’s bailable arrest warrant in the same contempt of court case while Imran had accused the ECP of bias in the party funding case to which the contempt of court issue pertains to.
It may also be mentioned here that yesterday Islamabad police had received the non-bailable warrant for Imran’s arrest issued by the ECP. The letter was sent to the SSP Islamabad by DG Legal Affairs ECO.
As per the text of the non-baialable arrest warrant Imran has committed contempt of ECP under the Peoples Representation Act  and thus he should be arrested and produced before the ECP at 10 a.m. on the morning of October 26.

column2: LNG Purchase From Qatar Challenged in IHC
column5:
Islamabad (October 17, 2017): The government contract for purchase of LNG from Qatar has been challenged at the Islamabad High Court (IHC).
The petitioner argues the LNG gas contract which the government signed with Qatar violates Public Procurement Regulatory Authority (PPRA) Rules and it would fuel corruption further.
The then federal Minister for Petroleum and sitting Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi did not fulfill the constitutional requirements while signing the said contract, the petitioner says.The petitioner also asks court to issue order for making the contract public and producing the relevant documents before the court.Petitioner Chaudhary Bashir advocate who has filed the petition through Akram advocate name Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi, Secretary Petroleum, Secretary Law, Speaker National Assembly Ayaz Sadiq, Chairman Standing Committee on Energy, Chairman Senate Raza Rabbani, National Assembly, and Chairman National Accountability Bureau (NAB) Justice (r) Javed Iqbal as respondents.
The petition submitted by petitioner’s counsel counsel Akram was received by the Registrar Office of the IHC.A single bench of IHC was to hear the petition today but Justice Amir Farooq was unable to hear the petition due to paucity of time while hearing the petition seeking disqualification of Mayor Rawalpindi Sardar Naseem in which the court issued order to keep Election Commission’s decision suspended till next hearing.

column2: Conservative People’s Party Leads in Austrian Elections
column5:
The conservative People’s Party (OVP), led by 31-year-old Sebastian Kurz, is projected to finish first in Austria’s snap parliamentary election, according to exit polls that suggest a clear shift to the right.
A projection by pollster SORA showed centre-right OVP winning  election with 31.6 percent of the vote, based on a count of all non-postal ballots. Kurz’s party, however, is far short of a majority and will need to form a coalition.
The centre-left Social Democratic Party (SPO) was on 26.9 percent, just ahead of the far-right Freedom Party (FPO) on 26.0 percent.
The projection had a margin of error of 0.7 percentage points, meaning the race for second place was too close to call.
However, It is likely that he will make alliance with Freedom Party.

column2: Justice Javed Iqbal Formally Takes Over as NAB Chairman

Javed Iqbal reached NAB headquarters on Wednesday morning to formally assume charge as head of the federal anti-graft body.
Click Play Button to Watch this Video

When Justice Iqbal reached the headquarters, Deputy Chairman NAB and other officers received him.Javed Iqbal appointment comes at a time when anti-graft watchdog is engaged in corruption cases against former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif and his family members.
Justice Javed Iqbal’s appointment was made after Prime Minister Shahid Khaqan Abbasi and Leader of Opposition in the National Assembly Syed Khursheed Shah developed consensus over his name following the mandatory consultation process.Iqbal replaced Chaudhry Qammar-uz-Zaman, whose term expired on October 10.

column2: Imran Calls Abbasi Puppet PM, Hints For Another Sit-In

The nations don’t fall from bombing or defeat but they get destroyed when the morals and ethics are destroyed.
